text: I like enchiladas.  So, naturally, I have been frequenting Gadzooks for a little over a month now and am more than happy to submit an almost perfect review of their establishment. Pros: Food is amazing.  With a very from scratch taste and feel I appreciate, along with new items that hit the chalk board and run the risk of availability, it's hard to go in and get the same old same old every time.  This is the one thing places like Chipotle can't exactly replicate and I admire; new flavors and dishes are what make this stand apart. Enchiladas are made to order with enough customization choices to keep you going back.   Pulled Buffalo enchiladas? I managed the last one and considered putting it up on EBAY.  The enchilada oven.  There is something special about watching your dish enter the oven and the cheese bubbles with happiness.   Cons:   Get there early.  Parking is at a premium though not as bad as most places on 7th st.  Here is my issue; the line.  The whole process operates like subway, chipotle, etc which isn't too bad but for the fact that your dish can come out of the oven and sit for minutes until you are able to pay, fight the single drink dispenser, and get seated.  I have on more than one occasion diverted to another restaurant if I spot a line out the door.   True, good things come to those who wait but I dislike lines for food so that is my only hangup with Gadzooks, who otherwise has some of the tastiest enchiladas made to order I have had the pleasure of sampling for some time.

What spicy, tasty food and a good value.  But "warning Will Robinson", if you are a little on the Asperger side or just have a difficult time with quick decisions, make sure you get a menu ahead of time to sort out the dozen or so decisions you need to make on each item.  It is also difficult to hear the server provide instruction across the much appreciated but very effective audio barrier, sanitary glass shield.  There weren't many folks ordering at the time I was there so I felt ok taking a lot of time sorting out my first visit,  but if there were a crowd I would have felt like a rock in the road.    Will I go back despite those issues?  Sure.  I tried a chopped salad, enchiladas and tacos with both kinds or tortillas, ribs, green chili pork and chicken.  The spicing was perfection. The food is amazing, the servers were kind and helpful and I might even go back just to watch the machine that ties up the to go boxes.

Love there tortilla soup its so good just wish they have you more of it. . My husband gets the enchiladas they are also very tasty. We really like this place, its our go to for good eats.  See ya guys soon.

Think of Chipotle ordering for enchilada and tacos...  but that is where the comparison ends.   My wife and tried this place yesterday for the first time.   We were very surprised the level of quality food, better than many higher end Mexican restaurants.

I can't believe how good this food is! At first I thought this was going to be just like Chipotle by the way they have it all set up, but this food is 10x better then Chiptole! They were sold out of the bison meat so I got the pork ribs instead and if the pork ribs were this good, I can't imagine how good the bison is! If you've been by this place and wondered if it's any good, it's definitely worth going!

Wow. Woweeeewow. Fresh, flavorful, fast, reasonably priced. Yes!  Are you that kind of person that doesn't like just one thing on your plate - but likes to sample many things and take a bite of each thing over and over going round the plate til you're done?  ME TOO.  Gadzooks is a dream for you and I! So many inside filling choices, so many topping choices, so many salsa choices... I basically tried everything and it was all amazing, and there are lots of veg friendly options including an outstanding corn bread filling that sounds weird but is so creamy and tasty you'll go nuts. And the tortillas are awesome which is a necessity.   I pretty much want to order another round and just spend the day here. Don't judge me you'd want to, too, if you were here.
Excellent food, the tortilla soup is the best I have ever had, staff was friendly and prices are reasonable for the quality of food.

Kind enchiladas! This place is like an upscale or fresher chipotle.  You make your own enchilada, nachos, or salad. All their ingredients are fresh and feel like they spend a little extra time to find the good stuff.   The Salas and sauces are awesome.   The location is a little small so it can get tight when they are busy, but they have great carry out containers.

A spicy 3.5 stars!  A good value and locally owned venture in central Phoenix.  Stopped in and tackled some tacos to go.  There was a wide variety of meat and veggie options.  Sampled the Short rib and Chile-pork tacos that both had a little zip to them.  The chicken tacos are the safest bet on the spicy barometer, but still flavorful.  The homemade flour/corn tortillas are a nice touch.  I'd take the staff up on the offer to melt the cheese in the wood fire stove as our food was a little cold when we got home.    I'll definitely go back to try some different combinations of meats and homemade salsas.  (Referring To-Go order) It seems that the packaging is a little over the top and wasteful - although beautifully done.  The food is served up in a circular aluminum foil pan, typical for Mexican fare, and then slid into an orange square sleeve for marketing purposes.  We had two dishes so they were then stuffed into a Spanish Inquisition styled contraption that then binds the two packages together.  While fun to watch the first time, it does slow down the line, then is annoying to cut off when you're to your destination and ready to scarf down.  All in all, I'd rather save the trees and the 45 seconds it takes to wrap them. (Perhaps change the packaging for the tacos as they we soggy when we got home)  The interior/exterior of the building are very contemporary, which adds to the allure of wanting to sit and have a beer with your meal. It makes a great alternative to Chipotle and your dollars stay local.  A few fine tweaks and it could easily be a 5 star experience:)
This place is very good. I really enjoyed the set up (like chipotle) and all the staff was very friendly and informative. Really hope a second location is opening up!!!
The tacos are awesome!!  Between the 2 of us we tried the chicken, pork, potato and cornbread versions.  All of them were great, but the cornbread taco was really good!!!

Like everyone else on here, I saw this place going up and had to try it.  As a mexican food fanatic I figured it would be interesting, but wasn't expecting it to be so good.  I really enjoyed everything I had.  I got 1 enchilada and 1 taco with green chile pork and the short ribs.  They were delicious and hot (tempature)!  I liked the meats that I got better here than at Chipotle or Qdoba (I heart their barbacoa).  Their "hot sauce" has a good spice to it, but I am always looking for hotter!  The only complaint I had was the noise echo.  The floors are concrete and just bounce all noise off them making it hard to hear and order.  Overall, I really liked this place and I would definitely come back, especially because it is so close to my job.

The food was beyond amazing. But, there has to be someone checking the customers out. At the times person working the cash register had to leave the register to chop up the salad. There's always room for improvement. Great place tho!!

Went to Gadzooks for the first time last week. Food was great. There was a mix up at the register and I had realized  I was over charged  $10 the next day. Long story short I called that morning to speak with the manager and he was able to see where I was over charged. He asked if I could go in to get the difference and I explained I lived in another city and it would be a long drive for me. He said that was fine he would mail me the difference with a gift card. I thought that was awesome.  What really blew my mind was when I got a knock at my door and Gadzooks employee hand delivered it with a written apology from the manager. This is not service you get every day. They really went above and beyond to make the situation right. Definitely will have to make a drive out to phoenix soon  to thank them.
Great enchiladas, all parts come together for a delicious meal. I had the green pork, very tasty.

This place is delicious. Better than chipotle if you ask me. Endless flavor combinations. You get a lot of food and it's gooood. The beef and cornbread mix was my favorite. I will definitely be back! Also the employees were super helpful in guiding us through the ordering process - offering suggestions - and they were super enthusiastic about the food!!

Great place, I love enchiladas and this place makes them great.  It has a Chipotle or Subway like setup of choice what you want. Service is great and timely. Also great options to, including vegetarian like spinach and mushroom or smash potato.

You want authentic Mexican food, Gadzooks has got it.  The bold and imaginative flavors blow my mind.  From the bison to the chicken, I can't go wrong.  I always choose the 1/2 and 1/2 tortillas to compliment my meats followed by a combination of sauces that I change every time I go.  I don't think I have had the same dish twice.  The quality is awesome and I love their friendly staff.  Can't wait to go back!

I tried Gadzooks because I wanted soup. The only soup they offer is Chicken Tortilla Soup. When I commented about this to the person behind the counter his reply was "The sign says enchiladas and soup, singular not soups plural. What did you expect?" To which I replied "At least Albondigas and perhaps Menudo on the weekends or some other kind of caldo(that's soup in Spanish)". $6.75 for two enchiladas that were not all that spectacular. Was not impressed and will not be returning.

We love this place. All the food has great flavor, but my personal favorite is one pork enchilada with green sauce and a short rib enchilada with red sauce with lots of pickled onions and cabbage slaw on top. We have two young children and it is their favorite place. They get to watch their food being prepared, don't have to wait for the food, and all of the staff are super friendly and helpful. We like it enough that we have brought out of town guests too.

Day 2 of their soft open and the food was still fantastic. The entire staff was super nice and a pleasure to interact with.   I ordered the Green Chile Pork and Short Rib Enchilada. Super good. House made corn tortillas were legit. Make sure to order it Christmas style for red and green.  The lava sauce is super spicy and flavorful.  Overall an awesome new spot in Downtown PHX!

What happened to this place? It use to be value for your dollar. They have cut down on food served but the prices stayed the same. The food quality seems to be slipping also. Such a shame since it use to be our go to place for enchiladas.

Trendy, yet good food. The soups are amazing! As for the line, well...good food but nothing to rave over. The one thing that killed it for me was them being skimpy on the sauces. Enchiladas should drown in flavorful sauces but this place is very tight on their pour. Their so wonderful soups are not advertised on the chalkboard (don't understand that since their tag line is: Enchiladas & Soup.) Overall, not a bad place, but wouldn't recommend it or take my out-town-friends there.
was not sure what to expect...but, it was fantastic. Some great choices and fresh ingredients.
Excellent enchiladas!  The place is a bit noisy but the food is good. A unique concept.

This place has a Chipotle type ordering system but the flavors and unique style of making the dish is absolutely great. I tried the two enchilada plus a lada for 2$ more. So I tried the chicken, pork and bison.. All very moist and flavorful. Topped them with cotija cheese sour cream and guacomole..I thought the prices are adequate. I highly recommend this place.

This is a terrific place, and I see a lot of folks agree. I am weighing in to contradict the Chipotle comparison. This is a lot more interesting food with richer, spicier sauces than Chipotle, which is adequate in a pinch but resembles factory food, at least to me. This is a terrific LOCAL place with its own spin on Mexican food, and the folks behind the counter are always friendly and helpful. I love having you guys in the neighborhood!   Try the pickled onion . . .
Cornbread enchiladas changed my life............ and this is coming from somebody who rarely strays from "authentic mexican food"  Highly recommend!

Just went here for lunch! First time and they made great recommendations for my enchiladas. I had the pork with corn tortilla and braised rib meat with flour. Great taste to the savory meats. Added both types of cheese offered and loaded it with all the fixens! Think of the ordering process like Chipotle but way better food and taste. Small dining area. Arrived for lunch around 1pm. Ideal as the downtown lunch crowd was pretty much done. No wait to order and eat! Atmosphere is simple with kinda of industrial contempory. Cannot wait to check this place out again.

I went the other day for lunch and the place is pretty good (really 4.5 stars). I got the cornbread enchiladas, a unique concept in and of itself, with the red sauce. The red sauce had a very mellow heat that didn't overpower the flavor and meshed well with the slightly sweet cornbread.   I will definitely be back to try some of the other menu items and support a local business that is churning out excellent food at reasonable prices.
Yummy, what else can I say ????ok I'll say it again Yummmmmmmmmmmmmmmy   Enchiladas   Eggs   Dessert,  yes please !!
The food is good and service is great. Get there early for lunch because it fills quickly.

Wow, this place is like nothing I have experienced before. So many choices... They only have a few menu items but you can personalize them however you like them. Kind of like an upscale version of that chain of sub shops.  It was pretty intimidating at first, you could tell the regulars from the newbies like me. I stepped back and listened to a few other people order before I jumped in.  They specialize in enchiladas that they make in a little cast iron skillet so when it comes out of the oven it is hot and melty. It was really great food and I definitely felt like I needed to come back and eat there again. My wife ordered soup and it was really good too.  In Midtown Phoenix, there are a ton of choices to eat and it's nice to find someplace that's different from all the rest.

An enchilada eatery that thrives doign things the right way. With fresh ingredients, fast preparation, and delicious results. By giving the people the choicest choices of ingredients and letting them decide how to dress it up, it gets a lot of comparisons to Chipotle, and while Chipotle deserves all due respect, Gadzooks has truly raised the bar for Phoenix-based Mexican food. The green chile pork and tomatillo chicken are delicious, the braised short rib is savory, the jack potatoes are unreal. Add the hand mixed guacamole for extra creaminess, the slaw for some crunch, or get the fried egg on top for an authenic (and filling) flavor experience. Go early to avoid the longer lines, just don't get it to-go, it's best when eaten fresh out of the oven. My only regret after each trip is not having enough room in the stomach to eat three more orders.

Stopped by for lunch. In my opinion and my opinion only, nothing special. Chicken and beef enchiladas covered with different sauces. Not very tasty. But, again, this is my opinion. I am not the best judge of Mexican food. The place was reasonably busy. Obviously, not everyone shares my opinion. And that is not a bad thing.

I found the food excellent,  and I'll definitely return. The downside is that it's quite busy, and that usually keeps me from visiting more often despite living nearby.  Definitely recommended if the parking lot isn't full.

Yummy! Just make sure if you do take out the person cooking it knows how long to keep your food in the oven. Been here several times but this time a girl cooked mine and when I got home the bottom was sticking to the container. It was burned

The food is ok but nothing special!, for rhe price, dont think it hits the mark,.with all those toppings, i think the true flavor is taken away, i thought the flavor was missing, bland even with toppings!
Food here is delicious, reasonable priced, and we just saw them feed a homeless person on the house!   Very thoughtful especially since it's Valentine's Day!
This was our first time here and the food was delicious! Everyone found something to suit them. Overall, the food was great, the restaurant is clean, and they were very helpful!

Amazing food. Have been wanting to go here since it opened. Cool design, lots of room, and awesome food. Very busy but worth the wait. I want to try everything on their menu.   Go nuts and get all the toppings...its worth it.   Finally the modern enchilada has arrived!!!
I love spicy food food but this was over the top!  They should have mentioned how spicy the dish was... I could barely eat it. I ordered tacos and received enchiladas.  I'll never go back.

The concept of the restaurant REALLY caught my eye when I first saw it being built.  I thought it was a great concept and was looking forward to trying this place. Unfortunately, it has the vibe of Chipotle. Don't get me wrong...I love Chipotle (which is much better & reasonably priced than this place).   I suppose I had a different expectation of Gadzooks concept "enchiladas & soups."  The staff was friendly, but their food was below mediocre. The portions are extremely small (3" tortillas and 1 ounce of meat--if you're lucky), the enchiladas really aren't enchiladas (I can attest to this as I am Hispanic) and there was nothing special tasting about the meat. Also, the price point for what you get is a little high.  I had 2 tacos and one enchilada (no sides are offered), chips & guac and it was $13!  Unfortunately, the meal wasn't very filling (and I'm a small girl).  I have no problem spending $13 on lunch, but it better be a larger portion than what fits on a 6" plate.  The tortillas were really good, in which they offer a 50/50 (corn/flour) tortilla option and the guac was decent.   To their credit, they had only been open two days and had someone walking around asking the customers for feedback on the food, pricing, portions, etc.  Hopefully they'll head our advice and will evolve into their concept of "enchiladas & soups," as I had high hopes for this place.

GADZOOKS IS AWESOME!!!!! Do you like Chiptole?  You will LOVE this place.  Take everything you like about Chiptole and multiply it by 10.  You're going to get better food, better service, etc.  Everything tastes fresh - it does not taste like you're eating precooked, reheated restaurant food.  I can't wait until I'm back in PHX to eat here again.

Am I the only person who thinks a restaurant that has SOUP in the name of the place, should offer more than 2 choices??? I was very disappointed not to have more soups to choose from. That said, an enchilada with the option of a Poblana pepper in place of a tortilla was an unexpected delight! It was getting busy when I was there and I felt rushed, but I will go back another time and try something different.

The food is very good. My favorite thing in the salad. It is always super fresh and the options are great for what you want in your salad whether you want all vegetables or not. I have also had the pork and the chicken tacos and I would totally recommend them as well.   The only drawback is the setting. There isn't a lot available and it is kind of cramped. Also, the chairs look great but are really uncomfortable. If you happen to have a backpack or purse you are going to have to eat with it in you lap because the chairs have a design that won't let you sling your things over the back without them falling on the floor.   Buuuuuuut, the food is very good so I still definitely enjoy coming here I just wish they would get better chairs.
I stumbled upon this place and I'm very impressed. The food was amazing. When they say spicy it actually is...which is rare. Lots of good options for vegetarians

Absolutely love the food here!  Some of the options sound a little weird at first, but everything tastes great!  I have been back many, many times to try out different combinations of enchiladas.  My personal favorite is combo of a spinach/mushroom enchilada and a cornbread enchilada.   It is very crowded at lunchtime, but the service is quick.  If you order take-out, you'll be on your way in just a few minutes.  For eating in, I recommend stopping by in the early evening.

Eating lunch here now, this place is so phenomenal that I had to stop and write about it. The employees here are magnificent. The food is incredible!  Our first time, and now our new favorite.  Check it out!

I love this place. I'm glad it's a but of a drive from my house or else i would be a fat, fat man. It's the upscale Chipotle of enchiladas. The service is quick, and their sauces are delicious, although they could be a little spicier in my opinion. The corn filling is to die for, I could eat it all day, and their green chile pork is great too. Any time I'm in the area i try to swing by. Still need to try it with an egg on top.

Customer service is always so friendly and helpful, especially with all the different options and explaining they have to do.  I always go for the mixed tortilla, and 50/50 meat and corn inside.  This place is the bomb, I recommend getting an over easy egg on top, uhhh so good. Trust me.

Love the food here. Biggest complaint is the disjointed ordering process and confusion about what is included, what isn't. Some simple edits to the chalkboard would clear that up. And the deafening noise level of the place doesn't help. Horrible acoustics combined with blaring overhead music is so chaotic  Even the staffer said she goes home and her head is spinning from the noise. And probably because customers--and staff-- have to ask "Wha?" 10 tines during the ordering process.

Just had dinner there and I can say, without a doubt, this place is great.  The menu is simple, the food is fresh and delicious.  I never thought of enchiladas as a great choice, but Gadzooks has changed my mind.    I really liked that there seemed to an eclectic group of people there.  Heavily tattooed ladies sitting at tables next to old guys in Hawaiian shirts, next to a couple of families with young children.    My wife, daughter and I chose Gadzooks for a late dinner after visiting the Zombie Apocalypse seminar at the Arizona Science Museum.  I loved the fact that the owners converted an old Gas Station into a great little restaurant.    The place was clean, nicely set up and staff were friendly, welcoming and very helpful in guiding us through the menu.  My wife and I split a two plus one enchilada deal and the portions were plentiful and delicious.    A special note, the guacamole was very fresh and flavorful.   Well worth the extra buck!  Next time I'm going to give the soup a try.  If it as good as everything else, I'm sure I won't be disappointed.   They only thing I would think that would make the dinning experience better would be more desert choices.  The pumpkin bread cookies were good, but a little bland compared to the rest of the meal.  To be honest, I would liked to have seen fried ice cream or at least a gourmet brownie offering, but that's just me.    Bottom line.......Five big ole gold stars.  Give Gadzooks a try, you won't regret it.

The enchiladas are simply delicious, served in a ceramic bowl that goes in the oven as the enchiladas are made to order. Really unique concept and great value: this is fast Tex-Mex counter service that tastes upscale without breaking the bank. The assembly line concept from Chipotle but done absolutely right. The atmosphere is about the same as Chipotle's but you won't care. They must know the menu is a neck-breaker, and like me, anyone going for the first time won't know how to order. If recommend getting the menu on a postcard before you get in line to order.

A friend recommended this place for lunch so we stopped by. It almost feels like a chipotle with the ordering set up but omg was it good. I had the beef short rib tacos and they were so good!! They also make their own tortillas which is awesome. I will definitely be returning next time I'm in Phoenix!!

I just went today for the first time.  Really cool concept and the options you can add to your enchilada and tacos are a bit more interesting than Chipotle (not knocking Chipotle).    I will say that as a first timer, it's quite a confusing way to order as the signage is directly above you so you have to step out of line near the tables to see the boards.  The decor is pretty hip.  Had to sit outside b/c  there really aren't too many tables inside, so that made the experience a bit sour b/c it's so dang humid and hot today.  Overall a cool spot and I hope to be back.

I have no problem with choices, I happen to like them. Yes, there are a lot of items to choose from but the staff is happy to have you taste sauces and such to make sure you get what you like. I found the staff friendly and very accommodating and willing to explain how everything is prepared and how everything works.  I especially liked the beef short rib filling. It was delicious and melts in  your mouth. I thought the chips were a bit greasy and weren't really needed with the filling enchiladas so I will probably skip that next time. I also think I added too much to my enchiladas and so I couldn't taste everything distinctly. But that's my problem.  My one problem is that the place is called Enchiladas and Soup. I was really hoping to try both. Why not offer a one enchilada/cup of soup combo?

This is a pleasant addition to the area.  The food is fantastic. Flavors of authentic mexican preparations; Roasted chile', fresh tortillas... A friendly fella preparing meals recommended I try the bison. He even went as far as offering a sample, which i politely declined and went straight for the bison as my enchilada choice. His sincerity while offering the meat option made me feel  that he was stoked to have it and proud to serve it. Strong choice!! They were phenomenal. I'll be heading back again, without a doubt. I didn't take note of a bike rack, however, it's certainly a place to consider for some tasty neighborhood eats. Thanks for all of your hard work and preparation Gadzooks, you're serving up great meals. I'll be spreading the word.

Uugh.  I too hate giving local businesses bad reviews, but the food there was simply terrible.  I ordered tacos and they served them up enchilada style.  I mean it was actually funny that all they had to do is give me tacos and instead they plunked massive amounts of cheese over these tacos and served them up enchilada style!  So I tried to eat them, and truthfully even if they just served me the tacos the food tasted terrible and it was overpriced to boot.  Finally, I know this is terrible to say, but the server girl in line had so many piercings on her face and in her nose it was kind of disgusting.  I get that people want to express themselves with piercings, but when I'm buying food from you, I don't want to see metal drooping out of your nose.  Just saying...
So damn good. Best enchilada i've had in a while. Oh the staff is SOOOO friendly and accommodating. The product is great, like who else has Bison enchiladas?

A Chipotle style place known for their tacos and enchiladas (but IMHO, they taste WAY better than Chipotle). Gadzook's uses a fire furnace to bake their dishes. Please do yourself a favor and try the nachos and their sweet & spicy cornbread. People also love their modelo braised bison, which they only serve at lunch and until they run out. Beware, often times the employees are snarky and confused. This happens because the food belonging to the people in front of you could take longer to bake or the food belonging to the people behind you bakes faster than yours. Or vice versa. It appears it's hard for the employees to hear the customers behind the glass separating the two parties, so maybe pick up some sign language skills  or learn the universal signs for tacos and enchiladas. But it's worth the confusion/frustration because this place is GOOD! You gotta try their icing glazed pumpkin cookies (gotta buy them in a pair which makes it perfect for sharing with your someone special or friends). This place is also fairly priced as you get a lot for your money.
Yeah, this eatery is as good as it gets when it comes to the flavors of authentic Mexican food.  If you haven't tried it yet quit procrastinating.  Friendly people working here too.
Was pretty good  Would not order the pork again the Chicken was delicious

These guys made the best enchilada ive ever had! I didnt know what I wanted so I just asked a dude there to make iy for me and it totally rocked. Later on in the day I burped and retasted it and I was like "man that was a good enchilada! Im going to download yelp so I can publically display my opinion on the place" so then I downloaded yelp and wrote this review.

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE IT!!!!  I've eaten there several times - probably once a week since they opened - and yes, the line is long and maybe the way they prepare your food could be a bit more organized.  But the FLAVORS..OMG...so worth the wait.  The fresh made corn or 50/50 tortillas that are made right before your eyes - they taste so good that I crave them.  I've had the tacos and the enchiladas and my favorite are:  1) to get one pork taco and one chicken taco with a mix of cheese, pico salsa, crema, and gotta get the guac; or 2) when I'm in the 'lada mood is to get one pork and one potato (yes-potato-they're AWESOME!!) with the red sauce and a mix of cheese, the pico salsa, the crema and the guac.  Two tacos or two 'ladas may not seem like enough, but it is...I can't finish them.  You can also add one more for an additional charge if you're really hungry.  The staff is great - they have a fanstatic attitude and give you service with a smile.  Even though sometimes it is frustrating to stand and wait when the line is out the door, you get a positive vibe.  The place is fresh and clean -could probably use more parking, but we ARE in downtown Phoenix.

I have never heard of Gadzooks until a friend suggested it to me.  I had no idea what to expect especially since the name does not imply anything.   Some people have compared this to Chipotle and I have to say that they're right in that you stand in line to order components that eventually create a taco or enchilada, and the ambiance is about the same.  But that's where the comparison stops.  The food was spectacular and the staff was very friendly.

I love love love Gadzooks! Best enchiladas in Phoenix! My dad is Mexican and this is better than his authentic enchiladas. The meat is perfect! The tortillas are perfect! The toppings are all fresh and yummy but the best part and the most important to me is the meat. Gadzooks does not disappoint me. Visit after visit I'm always satisfied. I've tried everything on the menu all delicious. The food is amazing. The ambience is okay. It gets very loud in there and I had to yell over the glass so they could hear my order. I know the glass is to protect the food from contaminants but it's so thick and high.

First off ya gotta love the name. But as for the food? Tasty....My wife and I were in for lunch and started with the same thing, half & half tortillas, one filled with short rib and the other green chile pork shoulder. Then we split, red sauce for me and green for her. Asadero (jack) cheese for her and chihuahua (cheddar for me. They then take the shallow serving croaks and put them in pizza type oven. Makes the cheese melt and really makes it service hot. Next the topping, pico de gallo and/or other salsa's. Maybe a little slaw and creme and for the salad some dressing choices. My wife tried a little vinaigrette on her enchilada and likes it. Like the menu says the green sauce is the yin to the red sauces yang. Red,smokey chile flavor, green smoother....green flavor. Chips (really good) and salsa on the side and we had a great meal.  I can see were folks would be concerned about the noise but it's the norm in places like this, hell I've been to high end restaurants that were noisier. Difference is there some of what I'm paying for is the ambience. Pricing here is so affordable for the quality of the food that the noise is part of it.   My only complaint is one I have read already. The menu placement sucks. First off it's a narrow space between the front door and the board and then it's so high up. This was our first time there and so with the extensive options and the overly helpful staff it was a little unnerving. Would have been nice to have it either in a little flyer type menu or on the wall at eye level. You try to order then have to keep stepping back to check the overhead menu board. Doesn't work for me.  All that aside we will return. Nice change of pace, hot and delicious and as stated before affordable.  Oh and please put your open days/hours on the website.

The food is great, but the service is slow. Be prepared to wait to get through the line if going at lunchtime. The cornbread and the short rib is full of flavor and perfect amount of spice. Getting a mix of the green and red sauce is a perfect way to top your enchilada. The cookies are delicious, but my last three visits they have been out.

Although it's not exactly traditional Mexican, Gadzooks is easily in my top three favorite Mexican restaurants in the valley.   The sauces and salsas have incredible flavor, the tortillas are tender and delicious and the taco and enchilada fillings are creative and crave worthy.  Jared is super customer oriented and I feel welcomed there.

When it comes to food, I am known to eat about half of whatever I order and save the rest for someone else to eat later. Not at this place; the food is delicious. It is not saturated in grease and has a unique way of preparation and presentation. The atmosphere is casual and cafeteria-style. It is like a higher end Chipotle. I keep telling friends to check it out and no one seems disappointed either.

I haven't heard the exclamation, "Gadzooks!" since watching an English drawing room comedy on TCM during Alec Guinness Week or something equally British and old timey. It's a great exclamation. Like, "Zounds!" or "Sacré Bleu!" or "Bollocks!" Things Americans don't say. We usually just say the "F" word.  So when we checked out the newly renovated and freshly opened "Gadzooks: Enchiladas & Soup" in a 40-year-old building that was originally a filling station, then Miriam's Designer Clothes (FYI: Miriam was not on Project Runway), we naturally said, "Gadzooks! There's a new restaurant in town!" When we tried it out, we said, "The F-word! These are darn good!"  Dang! I mean, who doesn't love a great enchilada, right? We feel a little territorial about things like enchiladas here in the Southwest, too, because we do them so well. Cincinnati may have its Skyline Chili. New Orleans has its jambalaya. Coney Island has its hot dogs. We've got amazing Mexican food here.  Oy! So when cute, scruffy, friendly owner Aaron Pool graduated from ASU he followed his dream: he opened an 'Enchiladeria,' let's call it. But Aaron's vision is unique: you can customize what's really a genuinely handmade enchilada with a variety of fillings, toppings, sauces and condiments. When Aaron had this, "A ha!" moment he said, "Gadzooks!" The rest, as they say, is history.  Gosh! Once you enter Aaron's clean, bright, airy "enchiladeria" you'll see the menu posted above the friendly assembly line where someone like the totes adorbs inky Eric will help you navigate your way through 'Lada Land. You'll see the fresh tortillas being pressed right before your very eyes. Choose either corn or the half 'n' half corn & flour tortilla. They're thick, fluffy; big on texture and taste. If you're not in an enchilada mood, try a street taco. You'll get two of either, and stuff 'em with something like Roasted Tomatillo Chicken, Green Chile Pork Shoulder, Guajillo Braised Short Ribs, the melt-in-your-mouth Modelo Braised Bison, or other succulent stuffings. I happen to be a fan of the Sauteed Spinach Mushroom, too. Aaron's up with the "pollos" preparing the succulent viands at 4 a.m. No kidding!  Boo-ya! Smother it! Pick your sauce, pardner! Red, Green or "Christmas" style with both. They pop these comidas into a stone oven, and you get it piping hot.  Zoinks! You've also got time to add salsa-- and they've got four to choose from. Mix 'n' match! Top it with scratch-made crema (a smooth, Mexican sour cream), cotija cheese, a crunchy, crisp cole slaw (we think it's fierce) and for a dollar more add sharp & creamy goat cheese, a griddle-fried egg or hand-smashed guacamole that's already rumored to be gaining a tasty reputation. Through the miracle of math, they've determined that there are 2,638,594 different combinations available. You won't get bored, believe me. You can even get a box of six enchiladas or tacos for $15 each to perk up your party. Talk about a bargain!  ¡Ay karamba! Now you've got yourself a pair of fine enchiladas or tacos, señors y señoritas! A pair is right around the $6.75 mark and you can add a third for only $2 more.  Hey! Prefer something lighter"? Opt for a customizable, freshly chopped salad for $6.75. Feeling carnivorous? Add some meat for about two bits or so.  Dang! Soup is given short-shrift here with only one to choose from. (We hoped the "soup" might be plural. It isn't.) It's a dilly, however. It's Linda's (that's Aaron's frequently on-site mom) who offers up a delicious housemade Tortilla Soup for $3.95. We can't help but wish it came in a bowl, however, instead of a paper "to-go"- style cup.  ¡Olé! If you really want a fiesta, try their 7th Street Sangria, Osborn Oro Margarita for $4 each, or a cool cerveza. That means, "beer." Currently "piped in," we're hoping they'll start brewing their ice tea, soon. Hint, hint.  Gadzooks! And that, amigos, is what they call, "the whole enchilada." You might even say the "F" word after you try 'em.

Gazooks, Gazooks, Gazooks - I wanted to like you, I really did. Enchiladas and soup - interesting concept though mysteriously, I found only one soup on the menu upon arrival. Yes sir, I was greeted by a single lonely Tortilla soup but yet the "soup" part somehow snug into the restaurant's naming convention. And while on the topic of corn, please know that asking your staff if the corn was organic was akin to asking "what is the meaning of life?" It required pondering so deep that I was unlikely to get an answer in this lifetime. So I resigned myself to my GMO corn maza and headed past some dried out looking fillings (was that mashed potatoes I saw??) for the toppings...still hopeful.  What an  impressive array indeed.  There is not much I don't like about Pico de Gallo, except maybe for someone fishing for the spoon in its deepest depths. Glove or no glove, I'm not a fan of anything that requires being buried wrist deep. Call it a personal preference. I finally sat down in the noisy room amongst my fellow starved and desperate cubicle dwellers. Upon first bite,  I suddenly understood the importance of the topping selection. You see, without the addition of every creamy substance known to man, your enchiladas are regretfully forgettable. The overall concept strikes me as an interesting cross of Chipotle and Subway - just minus flavorful food, but with the general poor training of Subway staff. So Gazooks, we are not a match. It's me, not you. (Disclaimer: The aforementioned phrase is designed to maintain your self-esteem while really expressing that  it is, in fact, you.)

I have already eaten there four times ! The food is great. The potatoes enchilada are amazing and I an obsessed with the pickled onions. chips and guac are great! Everything is freshly made every day and tortilla dough is delivered every day. I don't mind paying a couple bucks more for fresh local food with no preservative flavoring !
Food was tasty. Kinda hard to figure out all the choices your first crime. Menu was confusing.  Will definitely be back and work my way thru the menu.

My friend was raving about this place so we went over there together with our kids one evening.  They took her order right away, and then it was at least five minutes before they took our order.  There were five to six people behind the counter, but not much appeared to be happening.  There were two people standing directly opposite behind the counter, but they did not even say" hello", "welcome ot Gadzooks", or "be right with you".    Now, lets' talk about the menu.  Extremely confusing.  It's very unclear how to order a meal.  Additionally, there is no kids menu.  I asked if they could make my daughter a cheese quesadilla, which they were more than happy to do, but when I went to pay, I discovered that the quesadilla was the size of a small pancake, and they wanted 3.50 for it.  I told them for that price, they needed to add another quesadilla, which they did without question.  I think at Chipotle you can get an entire kids meal including quesadilla, rice, beans and drink, for about the same price.  So my suggestion would be to add a kids menu.    Okay, now for the food.  It was decent.  I ordered the spinach mushroom enchiladas with a goat cheese shmear.  I left feeling hungry.  A side of rice and beans would have been great.  I don't know if they offer that or not, but it doesn't come with the meal.    While my friend likes this place, and will probably go regularly, I doubt I will ever go back.
Fast casual spot that nails the atmosphere and showcases a variety of rich flavors. Staff excellent. I would highly recommend to others.

Love this place! The staff is really friendly and there are vegan/raw options. I ordered the spinach and mushroom enchiladas (no cheese) and I was impressed!  It's hard to make enchiladas taste good without cheese, but the house-made salsas and guacamole did the trick.  I'm glad to find another cool local restaurant, I will totally come back.

I never want to go to Chipotle again. Gadzooks is like a gourmet version of Chipotle, with comparable prices and mouth-watering salsas, meats, slaw and toppings to make your tacos/burrito/salad SO DELICIOUS.
MMMMMMMM I am a fan,.... The Green chili option is the way to go,.. The Bison wrapped in the Green Chili is the bee's knees!

Staff was very friendly and helpful, and I liked the novelty of the restaurant's concept.  There were four vegetarian options for enchilada filling (potato, corn, cheese, and spinach), and staff was very willing to point out what the vegetarians should not order.  The finished food was delicious!
Really great taste. So many options. Salad and enchiladas the best. Little wait during lunch hours but its worth it

The gimmick is cute, the food is filling and decently priced. I just wish that everything didn't taste the same. I've gone to this place maybe 20 times now and no matter what combo I try, everything tastes the same. There's no real distinction of flavors. For quick enchiladas or a decent chopped salad, it's not bad, but in no way is this a place I'll pick out as a first option.
Awesome chicken tortilla soup and you can add your own twist to it! Will definitely be back to try their enchiladas and other menu items.

First off let me preface by the fact that I am extremely lazy and don't normally review places, no matter how good it is. With that being said I took the time out of my extremely unoccupied day to make this review. That is how awesome this place is!  I have been here twice now, and the first time I ordered the green chili pork and short rib enchiladas. The second time around I got both short rib. The short rib has an amazing flavor, it just pops in your mouth!  The cotija cheese and habenero lava sauce are both fantastic. This last time I even tried a side of the herbal ranch, which was, you guessed it, great! I also tried a side of their cornbread this time around and was glad I did. With actual corn and a hint of spiciness to it, it was a great addition.  To top off this great meal, they even have alcoholic beverages. Pacifico being my favorite, I got that my first time through. After which I realized he had a cream soda on tap, and boy do I love cream soda! So this time around I got the cream soda, and my wife asked if they made margaritas. Which they did, so she got one. A pink grapefruit Margarita is what they served her, and it was very delicious! A little too strong for my wife, but I didn't mind finishing off for her.  For under $30 for a family of three and one alcoholic beverage and one soda, I will gladly be coming back here on a regular basis! I highly recommend this to anyone in the area or even if you have to make a bit of a commute. Every Phoenician should try this place at least once. Unless it's on a night I choose to go, in that case, go a different night. Parking is very limited and I'd rather not park across the street... ;-)
Just had Gadzooks for the first time at the AZ Taco Festival. In my opinion, they were the best tacos there. Highly recommend them - can't wait to go to their location and try other menu items!

We were so stoked to give this place a try, but we were seriously disappointed. A good concept and well-braised meats were not enough to compensate for the main sauces (red and green) falling flat. The red sauce was especially awful... bitter and I found it ruined the whole dish. The green sauce needed salt and lacked real flavor. Individual components were well executed, but the sauces literally destroyed the whole meal and I couldn't finish mine, despite attempting to scrape the sauce off. I would absolutely come back if the chef modified his main recipes as this neighborhood spot is loaded with potential.

This place is absolutely Fantastic! the green sauce and the chicken compliment each other so well. i definitely recommend.  The service is also really good, if they know you are new they will explain everything to you, and make sure that you understand. This place is exactly like chipotle, just a little less corporate. This place is a must visit, even if it is just once!

My home cooked enchiladas are better... For the price I left hungry and disappointed in the lack of flavor. If I'm not gonna cook at home I'd rather go to a hole in the wall place with better food and better prices.

I finally made it to the place tonight and was pleasantly surprised!!  The concept is similar to chipotle but still has its own unique experience. The staff was very helpful and knowledgable of their products and would recommend this place to anyone.

First...the food is great, every time; however, tonight the staff and restaurant were shameful. Long story short, the restaurant has no screens to block the hot afternoon sun from turning the place into a heat box. Chain reaction, the AC couldn't keep the place cool, and thus the ice machines ran dry as they couldnt produce ice.   So, what did the staff (there was no manager in sight) do?  One said, "we should probably send someone to get some ice at circle K" when I asked if he knew that not only was their machine empty, but that the beverages served were warm (note that in the time i waited for my food, no one came with or went to get ice. None of the staff said, "oh I'm sorry. Our machine is out of ice and not chilling the beverages in the fountain either", as people were ordering a drink. And none of them offered an alterative, either.  Poor staff training, lack of skilled management, and a facility incapable of operating correctly on a hot summer day...hmm, I know we've had a few of these already this summer. How can this be?  Wake up owner.

What a great concept and place to eat! It was our first time visiting Gadzooks and didn't know what to expect. We were greeted by Jessica who was so friendly and walked us through the entire process. All of the staff there were so nice, helpful and friendly that I will be back because of their great service and good food! Even the other customers were so nice, giving us advise on what to get! We sampled many sauces and toppings! We can't wait to visit again and try new combinations!

This place is so good!  It is like Chipotle but way better!  Many choices for salsas and sauces.  It was a bit overwhelming the first time.  Thank goodness for their very helpful and friendly staff.  What a fun and delicious place!
Yes! So much yes in a resounding fashion!   Great food. pretty much any way you get it. Service is really cool, great recommendations. Quick if you want take out. I love this place.
Great variation of chipotle but with enchiladas.  A good quick lunch.
Great location, awesome concept and the food is excellent. It's worth the trip if you aren't in Phoenix.
Fabulous food.  It asked for Corn tortilla and got a freshly created one.  Choice of flavor and speed of service was great as well.  We will be back.

Food is great. Love the fresh homemade tortillas. And all the sauces there are amazing!  Love the potatoes they offer too.  Definitely a great place for lunch, does get pretty busy so I would recommend calling in your order if you are in a hurry. I will be coming back again soon!

Finally!!! Had time to visit Gadzooks! It is wonderful!  A little intimidating at first if you don't check out their menu prior to going...ordering can be overwhelming...but worth every minute! I had pork tacos with the 50/50 tortillas!!! And a friend had the chicken tomatillo enchiladas!!! The BEST I have had in awhile! I will definitely be going back to try other combos....as an employee recommended the beef tacos! YUM!

We've been wanting to try this place for a long time and we finally had the chance today. I got the green chili pork enchiladas with half red, half green sauce. The green sauce was very flavorful and slightly spicy. I didn't really care for the red sauce though. Although it didn't make my top 10 list of favorite Mexican food restaurants, I would go again.
Just like Chipotle, but better! Try the tortilla soup or the enchiladas!
Good stuff!! Unique flavor.  Quick service.  Definitely worth a try!!

I didn't understand all the hype to this place. I like that it's set up Chipotle style so you get to pick all your toppings. I just didn't think the enchiladas were that great. When I asked for the green salsa, they pretty much drowned it in it so that was all I tasted. The meat (I had chicken and green chile pork) was ok in flavor. It was a decent place but I don't see myself returning.

I'm usually not a fan of Subway type meals and I did not know that that's what this place was but tried it anyway.  The menu is way above your head, and trying to figure out what you're getting was difficult because I could not understand the person who was serving me; it did not help that the glass wall between the food and the customer was taller than most.   I gave Gadzooks 3 stars because I had the red enchilada sauce and it was anything but special it tasted like something from a can and it gave me heartburn. The meat was okay. I had cross rib in one and the cornbread filling in the other. CORNBREAD filling was the tastiest but the sauce  didnt work.  The staff was ok, friendly but again, it was hard to understand over the glass partition.

Boom-Pop-Pow-Bam  Holy enchiladas Batman!   This is a nifty location, a funky idea, and yummy eats all thrown into a clay dish and roasted over a fire.   The menu is fun, great selection but controlled enough to do what they do exceptionally well. Menu-drawn in chalk, not a unique idea I know but boy does it just fit this place.   You walk to the counter... Kinda like chipotle. Pick your stuff, they cook it in the dish... In the fire.... Right in front of you.   I had a chicken burrito with green chili and a side of con bread.... Oh sorry I'm from the south... Corn bread.  Man it was good. Just a cool experience with a helpful staff and good food.   Nuff respect. You should try it at least once. Cuz cuz cuz I said so. What's the worst that could happen? I'm mean really.   An I'm out....s

It's OK, I've been there once and I need to go more to experiment with the menu.  The menu is kind of complicated.  I've never made enchiladas so I was lost.  I think they should have favorites or something to that effect to help out ordering
Gadzooks catered a party we had for 22 people.    The food arrived hot, labeled and included utensils.  Everyone loved it.  The food was delicious (our new favorite)!

So I Went plain jane today.. Got 2 braised beef enchiladas with green sauce and of course cheese : )  Tried the mashed potatoes this time. They most definitely should be on everyone's To-Eat List. Very creamy till the last drop.. Nom Nom Portions are generous.. My 8 year old and I shared this... and were stuffed.

This place was great. I spent a lot of time in the starbucks across the street doing homework and one day made the adventure across the street with my roommate and it was a great decision. The set up is kind of like Chipotle but the quality of food is so much better and a great variety of flavor. Check it out!

Great concept and the food looks wonderful.  The staff could be more helpful in guiding you through the steps (especially for first timers). The food looks so good but the taste was very salty.  Among our family we had all the proteins in the enchilada, guacamole and the tortilla and corn chowder soup.  Soups were good, everything else tasted very salty.

Wow... "...This thing could be nationwide" Steve says to me... in between shovels of warm, gooey jalapeno corn bread... and boy has he hit the nail on the head... The staff; informative, engaging, entertaining bunch of 'my kind-ofs'.  All I have to say is go... if you're a vegetarian? GO... if you're a meat eater? GO... something out-side-the-box? Go go go.

Love love love this place ... Has somewhat of a chipotle set up but better.   My go to order is two enchiladas on half & half tortillas, one spinach & mushroom other filled with cornbread, a smear of goat cheese on both, cheese, green sauce , medium egg on top and as far as toppings jalapeño ranch, creme & pico   Oh and there chicken tacos are pretty yummy aswell but honestly you can't go wrong with this place ... They have so many goodies tho
YUMMY. When I do get a minute to run out for lunch (so rare) I RUN to Gadzooks! Never disappoints, thanks guys!
The food at this place is so good!!  I love everything I've ordered from here. They also have spicy things. I love it! Such great place.

Amazing! Excellent value. The enchiladas are delicious. I didn't know they were fully customizable, but they are. You can't really go wrong with any of the choices.  As for soup, there is only one kind of soup, but it's as customizable as the enchiladas. I'll definitely be back.

Quirkly good... Aligned with other reviews, it is similar to a Chipotle, but with enchiladas as the main fare. The ordering process is a bit clumsy, but the results are darn good.  I opted for a mix of veggies enchiladas - smashed potatoes, spinach, etc.. They are hand rolled and topped with the sauce of your choice. They add a few options - cheese, pico, etc.. that you can choose from.  The end result was top notch. Spicy, but not overpowering. Hot, but not so burning hot that I could not eat it immediately.   The chips was really good as well.  Stop in, piece together enchiladas your style, pop a squat and enjoy. I will be back....

We drive by this place all the time and finally decided to stop in,  so glad we did!  We had tacos and enchiladas,  and it was delicious.  The jalapeño ranch was an awesome recommendation from the staff.  Staff was courteous,  polite and patient.  Will definitely be back.

The line to order is very congested and is not efficient (be prepared to be 25 min waiting in line), of course if the food was any good you could ingore this, but the salsa was just hot without any flavour and the food was very blend. Is a cool concept that wasn't well executed.
Never disappointed!! Friendly staff, awesome good, go sangrias and cookies! Hit the spot!!

Marvelous dinner for two tonight and the first time we were at Gadzooks.  A novice at ordering enchiladas with the fillings and add-ins and toppings a mystery, we took the advice of a few male prep cooks and were very pleased.  I had green chilies pork and my son had the short rib enchilada.  Took the advice of another reviewer and ordered the Christmas sauces, both red and green - great choice!  The hand smashed guacamole is a great addition.  The flavors were so fresh and the presentation delectable.  Cheers for the staff, they really brightened our evening and made us feel comfortable.  We will definitely be going again!  On the way out I saw the chopped salads being made and this is on my list for next time around.

This place is awesome. I highly recommend the green chili pork shoulder and short rib enchilada Christmas style along with tortilla soup. They were both absolutely RIPPIN!! Highly recommended. Also got one of the best margaritas in the valley. We will become regulars here in now time at all.
The most flavorful food with great presentation. I had one bison and one braised rib enchilada and the flavors where best in town. Must eat at.

Ate there for the first time today as everyone continued to rave about it. Although the spinach and mushroom mixture was good I was not impressed. Too pricey for what you get and the green sauce tasted like you were sucking on nothing but lime.

Yum!!  First time eating here and I can't wait to come back.  Loved the guajillo braised short rib and red sauce!!  Linda's homemade tortilla soup with chicken...perfect amount of spice with wonderful flavor.
Never had anything resembling a bad experience here. Food is always good, the staff is quick and always recommending something. I'm in and out in 5 minutes and pleased with my visit.

Gadzooks is one of my favorite places in Phoenix to eat.  I live nowhere close but will absolutely drive here just to eat.  It's like Chipotle (but better) for enchiladas.  First, you start with this incredible tortilla that is their own 50/50 blend and then add your fillings and toppings.  They have some wonderful veggie fillings like spinach and mushrooms.  I usually get the chicken and a side of cornbread.  Cornbread?  Yes, it will blow your mind so do not miss it.  Next you choose a sauce, I go for the verde because I'm #teamgreenchile and love the spicy sweetness.  The red is also good and packs a powerful smoky flavor.  Then I load up with both jack and cheddar cheeses and it gets tossed in the oven to get gooey and magical.  Then I'm topping it all off with pico, habanero salsa, pickled red onion, and crema.  It's just so damn delicious that you will not be able to get enough.  Stop reading this review and get yourself to Gadooks.
Friggin delicious. The tortillas, meats, cheeses, and sauces are all delicious and combine to form highly crave-able enchiladas. My favorite is green-everything (pork, sauce, etc.).

Delicious food!!!  This concept is amazing!!  Everything is good...short rib and green chili chicken is my favorite!!  Then there is the jack potatoes...yes potatoes which are amazing!!!  The corn bread is yummy but has a good kick!  The chips are super crunchy, I could eat the whole bag!  Then finish the meal off with a pumpkin cookie....omg good!!!    Wish there was a location in the west valley, but it's well worth the drive!!!  Can't wait to go again

In essence this restaurant is a Chipotle, but with enchiladas instead of burritos. The food is good, but I feel I paid a bit too much for two enchiladas. Still, if you got the coin and want to try a tasty, trendy restaurant then give this place a shot.
FABULOUS - No words needed but Yelp wants me to say more.  Give it a try, don't think you will be disappointed.

I first noticed Gadzooks when I was getting my morning dose of caffeine at the Starbucks across the street. Ended up deciding to come back after church for a quick lunch.  The ordering process is similar to Chipotle. They offer enchiladas, tacos, salads and soup. I went for the enchiladas and did one chicken and one short rib. I have my eye on the smashed jack potatoes or the sweet and spicy cornbread next time. I went with the half flour half corn tortillas, both cheeses (jack and cheddar) and their red sauce as I prefer non-spicy.  My enchiladas went into the oven similar to what you'd see at a quick bake pizza place like Fired Pie and were ready quickly. There are ample options to top the enchiladas with.  The staff was friendly and helpful as I navigated all the options for the first time. I wish the menu was easier to view from where you stand as move down the line ordering. A stack of menus at the start of the line would solve the problem.  The concept is fun and unique. I'll be back to try more enchiladas soon!

Do not be intimidated by the ordering process. The staff will walk you through the process and the results are worth the effort. We told the person sitting next to us at a Diamondbacks game where we were planning to eat at the end of the game. He told us that we should go to Gadzooks instead. The food is very good - perhaps what Chipotle would like to be able to serve. The prices are reasonable.

This is my first time here. Man, it was SO good! Not what I expected all! WAY better then chipotle for sure! They mean business, stuff is spicy here. I don't like burn your face off but usually places hottest sauce is perfect. Not the case here- the hottest salsa was so hot there was no way I could eat it! Super yummy, and will be back!
We love this place and the concept! Great food! Simple menu of enchiladas, tacos, and soup! Never had anything bad!
They have an excellent vegetarian options, great tasting ready made white wine sangria and some very good pumpkin cookies.

Hesitantly tried a cornbread enchilada and I must say it was surprisingly delicious. The verde chicken was just okay but the sauces guac & melted cheese made everything better! I'll be back to try out more stuff!

I usually eat at this place 8 times a year and the vibe was different tonight.  We ordered as usual but now there is an emo dude that's serves Dainty portions and created an awkward moment when requesting a double portion. Maybe he needs more training. Long story short the line leader made it right.  4 stars.

This is a fancier, more expensive and slightly unhealthy version of Chipotle.   Pros: Food selection is good if slightly unhealthy. Ingredients are fresh. Decor is great.  Cons: More expensive than chipotle and chipotle has more flavor. Unhealthy sauce and cheese selections. Food is somewhat bland and flavors are muted.

This has to be my favorite place to go eat in Phoenix. I absolutely love the enchiladas. The entire concept of the restaurant is brilliant. It's like a chipotle for enchiladas, But way better. Sometimes it gets pretty busy at lunch so timing is important, but that just goes to show you how good this place is. I cannot recommend this place enough gadzooks is the bomb.com.
Good food, fun vegan and vegetarian choices.   The sweet and spicy cornbread filling in an enchilada is amazing.   Thumbs up.

Great food. It's got flavor and it tastes fresh. It was the perfect lunch on a cold and rainy day. I had three enchiladas with green and red sauce and some fantastic habanero sauce. Did not leave disappointed and hope to come back soon.

I wish this place was closer to my house! I think I would be there everyday! I got 2 enchiladas with the 1/2 and 1/2 tortilla with one mashed potato and one with chicken! I think I could of eaten a whole bowl of mashed potato. They add either green or red, or even both sauces and cheese and put it in their brick oven and add some cabbage slaw! Everything just tasted so fresh! I will be going back very soon!

Yummy Yummy, get in my Tummy!  This place was awesome!  So my lady and I were craving some Mexican food and were thinking about Carolina's, or Most Wanted Taco Shop. Well my brother recommended Gadzook's so we wanted to give it a try.  I'm glad we did.  This place was amazing!  We ordered some taco's and enchiladas.  We sampled the three different meats, short rib, green chile pork and chicken.  All the meats were braised and had were super flavorful.  The concept is a lot like Chipotle or Cafe Rio, but the food was a lot more tasteful.  You'll notice the difference when you sample their meats.  You order from the counter and they make your food right in front of you.  A lot of different options, with their sauces, cheeses, and salsa's.  In conclusion, if you like Chipotle, please give this place a try.  It blows Chipotle out of the water!  I'm a little upset I didn't find this place sooner.  I highly recommend and will be going back soon!

We stopped in on a whim and we were glad we did. This is no ordinary taco shop! We ordered two smashed jack potato/marinated spinach & mushroom enchiladas, covered in spicy green sauce with just a touch of homemade guacamole and two orders of tortilla soup. I went with the corn tortillas, which are thick and did not get soggy and disintegrate as soon as the sauce touched them. The flavor of everything was outstanding and the portions were just right. I have no need for a burrito that weighs as much as a bowling ball although I realize that for some people, more food = more value. I will take more flavor anytime. For the meat eaters, I noticed that they have short rib, bison, chicken, and I am sure some type of beef but I wasn't pay that close of attention to that. The menu is simple but there is a wide variety of toppings and fillings to customize your order. The prices are reasonable, too. The enchiladas, soups, and three drinks came to a grand total of $20.13 and we were more than satisfied. We will be back!
Delicious with great gluten free options! My favorite is a taco with half potato and half short rib topped with the cabbage and pickle onion and a side of the tomatillo salsa.

This place is great.   They are doing a great job considering they haven't even had their grand opening yet!  Food is delicious, staff is helpful and nice and they all really want to know how to make everything better and are actively working on it. I did not find the menu confusing, you choose your tortilla, filling, cheese sauce and topping ... not hard.   Keep it up! You're doing a great job and you can only get better from here :)

So I have a love-hate relationship with Gadzooks....  Love, because their food is oh so delicious. Hate, because I can never stop eating when I'm there. Gadzookz is often compared to Chipotle but it's so much more than that. You can choose between tacos, nachos, a salad or their famous enchiladas. The protein options are super unique - braised short rib, Modelo-braised bison, and spicy cornbread to name a few! Once your tacos, enchiladas, etc. are stuffed theyre topped with shredded cheese and placed into an oven to get all ooey gooey.   Even the toppings are exquisite! My favorite is the perfectly pickled red onions. You can top off your meal with chips, tortilla soup, or delicious homemade pumpkin cookies.   The line for lunch is always out the door and for good reason! This has definitely become a staple for my coworkers and I!

Love Gadzooks!! This is one of my favorite neighborhood joints :) I love their white wine sangria...I'm not sure if it's always available, but if you see it then you must try it! You will not be disappointed! Lines can get a little long, since everything is made to order. However, it is definitely worth the wait!

I love the concept of this place. Build your own enchiladas or tacos?! Yes please! This was my first time here so I decided to try as many combinations as possible for my enchiladas. One corn tortilla, one 50/50 tortilla, tomatillo chicken, green chile pork, Christmas style with the sauces and both kinds of cheese. They shove it in the oven and gooey cheesy magic happens. Topped mine off with green & red salsas, slaw, guacamole, and crema. So freaking good, it's not even funny. I will definitely be back!

Second time to Gadzook's. Less crowded. The food is tasty, but bit spendy. They really need to come up with a different shaped plate for tacos, perhaps one with little dividers that hold taco up, otherwise the tortillas sit in juice and you end up eating like an enchilada.
Lots of choices at this build-your-own enchilada or taco restaurant. The tomatillo chicken was delicious, as well as the green chile pork. They put it all together assembly line style. Worth a try.

Went there with high expectations.. Did not find the food that good.. It was an ok experience.. I like Mexican food spicy but this place disappointed me on the spice level I expect from Mexican food.. The red sauce a huge disappointment.. The meat filling options for the burrito are very few..  I have been to better mexican restaurants..

This is my go to place. Sometimes I come here 3 times a week.. The food is innovative, fresh and delicious. I've tried all the meat, but the best by far is the short rib. I always do the half and half tortillas because I hate how corn fall apart. Both cheeses and Christmas sauce is the way to go! The pico recently got a lot spicier because they add jalapeño now, so I go a little easier on that. Then I drown my melty enchiladas in the gadzooks buttermilk, crema and cotija. Incredible dressing! The salads are also good and large. They chop everything together with a large blade. Try the gadzooks buttermilk and short rib. You will not be disappointed!
I really like the style and menu. Really loved the short rib enchilada and the corn bread enchilada ! The salsa and sauces are great. I will be back.

This place is so fun! I live in the east valley and my friend lives on the west side, so we love to find places to meet in Phoenix. This was the perfect spot. I tend to ask a million questions and the staff was more than happy to explain  anything and everything to me! I also love that they have red cream soda. It might look exactly like Chipotle but the flavor and quality is way better! Perfect Saturday afternoon lunch place.

Mmmm Mmmm this place is absolutely AMAZING! Tried it for the first time last week, had a Chipotle like feel to it, but it is way better. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a quick home style enchilada.
Amazing concept. Clean restaurant with fantastic service and food. I've paid MUCH more for much less quality. We will be back... probably too frequently.
The best mexican I've had in ages. Tops chipotle by a long shot. I wished I lived in PHX to get to enjoy this delight haha
Amazing food and service! The people in front of us and working were so kind. I loved how they actually "chop" the salad. Unlike any place I've ever been.

I stopped by Gadzooks on my lunch break. I was looking for a quick and delicious lunch and Gadzooks sure did satisfy. My co-worker and I were both quite impressed with the flavor, super yummy. It took about 10 minutes to get through the line which is not too bad in my opinion. I took the food to go. The restaurant was very crowded and a little small as was the parking lot. But all in all, I would be willing to eat here again! Maybe, I'll try the salad next time!

A coworker and I stopped in here for lunch today after hearing about it from a friend. The parking situation was pretty rough but after circling the block once or twice we got a spot. Right off the bat I noticed the authentic vibe of the place and the menu was super unique. Of course I got the enchiladas as did most of the patrons as far as I could tell. They let you customize the ingredients from the stuffing to the cheeses to the salsas and toppings. They also bake the enchilada right there in front of you once they make it. I ended up getting the spinach mushroom stuffing and it was absolutely delicious. I really want to give a five star but the prices and parking bring it down to four...for now. I will definitely be back.

Went back to give it another shot (now that we had experience ordering).  I really wanted to try the bison which was out the first time.  Now the bison is only available at lunch...huh?!?!?!!   This time was total opposite...the food was not very good but the service was really great.  I had the potato enchilada and the chicken enchilada...pieces of the chicken were almost inedible, almost like they mixed overcooked, old chicken in with new chicken that was cooked OK.  The chicken alone ruined the whole meal.  There's a slim chance I would give it another shot, but with that chicken and now bison only at lunch...probably not.

This is a slightly fancier version of chipotle. Fancier, because the enchiladas are heated up. You choose your enchilada fillings; I got one with beef and one with pulled pork. On top, I added a mole (sp?) sauce, tomatoes, pickled onion (that's a unique topping!), cabbage, shredded cheese, and crema (aka: sour cream typa thang). Overall, very tasty and would recommend the pulled pork. Still, the sign outside said enchiladas and soup: where the soup at? Did my eyes miss it on the menu? Finally, it was so hot inside. Coming from a hot outside, it was uncomfortable to be eating warm food in a hot room... Nevertheless, service was very friendly and would return again

I'd base it 5 stars based on the food but the service was out of control terrible. We travel from the east valley to come here so Im not sure if this is normal for them. I hope they were training new people or something and this is not normal. The entire restaurant had empty tables with no one eating while the line wrapped back by the bathrooms. The line was barely moving and I saw several people leaving. I was shocked at how ineffecient the workers were at taking our order and making the food once we finally got to the counter. The one black girl in the back was basically doing everything and working her tail off while the two young girls in the line just looked around confused. You just can't have a line wrapping around the restaurant like that and no one who has food. See pics.
Fun and quirky. Great price point foe fresh food. Very casual... not sure what we were expecting, but it was yummy and we weren't disappointed.

Love this place.  It's a build-your-own enchilada - like a much classier (and tastier) version of Chipotle.  You pick from a decent list of everything, then they throw it in an oven to cook it up as you progress through the line.  Great concept for enchiladas, and I love the results.  I'm always super satisfied and pleasantly full, and the pricing is pretty decent.  Highly recommended.

Fun concept that works with the quality of the food they serve. Enchiladas and tacos are primarily their forte. The short ribs are smokey with some zip. Chicken is light and mild but flavorful. The selection of topping is original and the slaw is tasty.

I've been here a few times now, at first I was really excited but have liked it less and less. I've figured out that I find the meats themselves really bland, and the sauces to be overly seasoned. Maybe it's the toppings I use but with a pretty standard mix the flavors don't blend well and after a few bites I just don't enjoy the meal. I also agree with everyone else on the confusing order setup.

I'm a lover if more traditional mexican food. So my review probably more of a preference. I went for lunch. My first mistake. Parking very limited. Inside Nice clean...line almost out the door. In this heat, not a good thing. Interesting concept. However have to better judge cooking time. Once something burned.  That flavor is in all the food. Having a designated person do the cooking to better watch & a designated person to chop the salad would make more sense. Particularly during rush times. It took half hour to get thru line. Even the girl at the register was chopping salads. Hmmm.... Then no bag to carry food?  Really? Get rid if the sleeve for the to go orders. Nobody cares & it takes too much time. If you don't watch your order  there is large margin for error. Salsa I got & Guacamole overpowered by onion. The chicken & pork were ok. The potato,  to me, overpowered by onion. I'm not an onion lover so options would be nice in that aspect. For what I paid,   the time it took & inconvenience of balancing my food while Trying to open the  door & gate, burned oniony food..my money better spent elsewhere where I have more options. But gave it a try. Oh...the cornbread was good & spicy. Best part of my lunch.

We love it here! Always seem to miss out on the model braised bison. But everything else, from the green Chile pork and braised short ribs to the smashed Yukon golds and sweet and spicy cornbread is amazing! Location is awesome too!
Took off one point for the fact that this place really needs some blinds...seriously the staff and the customers are blinded by the sun shining in your face or reflecting off the glass

Gotta say, AGAIN, this place is absolutely incredible!! I don't understand the comments about the staff being sullen or uncaring....every single time I've been in, the staff have been welcoming, friendly and knowledgeable! And the food simply cannot be beat. BEST enchiladas I have EVER had. If they sold the half corn/half flour tortillas by the dozen, I'd be in heaven. The guacamole is ALSO the best I've ever had, but by far my favorite thing on the menu are the smashed jack potato enchiladas! Perfect Mexican food with a modern twist! And I'm not a huge fan of spice or food drowning in sauce, so recently when one of the staff recommended I try it with just cheese & crema....let's just say my whole world was rocked. I'd eat there every single day if I could! And oh my goodness, the pumpkin cookies that are by the register are worth the trip in and of themselves!! If you have not tried this place yet, do yourself a favor and get there asap!!! This place is an absolute treasure in the Valley!!!

OMG.  I hate reviews that start that way but it's the best I can do this place is awesome think of chipotle in its early years. Fresh food great flavors and good prices. Staff is friendly and very helpful in talking you through the process  will be coming back for more

GADZOOKS!!! The name says it all.... I have been waiting for this place to open and have been folowing on Facebook for months and when I finally heard there was going to be a soft open/ lunch service I jumped at the opportunity to full fill my enchilada craving.  As everybody has been saying the owner Aaron was very helpful and a shorter man that had a striking resemblance to Sean Astin (the guy from Rudy/ Lord of The Rings) was also very informative about the menu. I ate the short rib enchilada and the chicken, both took me on a one way trip straight to flavor town. If it was winter and I was wearing socks.... they would have been blown off.   "On top" you have got to get the Guac, it cost a little extra, but trust me.... just trust me K!!  One thing I was not expecting was to see somebody hand making tortillas and asking me, "corn" or "50/50" (a half corn half flour tortilla). Knowing full well that swimsuit season is just around the corner I decided what the heck, 50/50.... and for those of you that don't know, 50+50=100. and those tortillas are 100% delicious.   A side of chips came in handy to scoop up the remaining guac, sauce and cheese left from my devouring of the Lada.
