Side note - to the person that said $1 for guacamole was too much - I hope you realize it's $1.80 extra at Chipotle, and try to make your own guac for cheaper...people do have to make some kind of profit, whatever measly amount they get from your $1.

Similar to Chipotle, but on a local Phoenix mom n pops level, and with enchiladas instead of burritos. I really like that it's local!  Pros: -Local -Simple decor with good ambiance -Fast friendly and helpful service behind the counter. -Plenty of choices to fill and and top your 'lada  Cons: -The menu is way above your head on the wall and hurts your neck to read it. -Maybe too many choices and somewhat confusing what to add and when to add it. -Food tastes decent,nothing special, not terrible but all kind of tastes the same. We had four ladas with four different meats, sauces, and toppings and couldn't really taste much difference between the four.  I would probably give this place another shot, but maybe try tacos and soup next time.

Will definitely be coming back!  I had the roasted tomatillo chicken enchiladas w/red sauce & my husband had the pork w/green sauce - we both added an over-easy egg on top of all our fixings - NO complaints here! So fresh! We even tried their cocktails, mimosa & grapefruit margarita - fresh, crisp & amazing!

Good food but not worth the wait nor cold food. Been here once and I was not impressed w/ how inefficient the staff operated. The take out is served in a Aluminum container w/ wrapping paper and strings as a lid. Took about 30 minutes to get through the short line and by the time I got home my food was cold. Food was def over priced.

Food great, customer service sucks, they don't explaining how their system works, and to be honest it's confusing. They were rude and rolled their eyes like they had no patience. They need to smile and ask they the customer had they visited before!

This place never disappoints! My husband and I love their enchiladas (try the cornbread one for something a little different and delicious). The soup is great and I can never leave without one of their pumpkin cookies (they are year around).   One bad thing: Can be very busy during lunch rush hour -- but well worth the wait if you have the time.

I think the food is very tasty and the restaurant is very unique.  The influence of the Chipotle chain is obvious.  I liked my meal, but I probably won't come back because it is too expensive for what you get.  There's just not enough filling in the enchiladas, or it needs to come with a side of rice and beans included.  I had no problem with service and parking.  If it weren't for the price and/or portion size, this would definitely be my new favorite restaurant!

Love their food and set up, quality is quite impressive given that it has a chipotle style line up. Many options to customize your meal and been their several times just not too often as my heart can't take the deliciousness as you probably know why with any Mexican food.
Random stop here.  Delish and fresh.  I'd eat here everyday if it was an option.    My suggestion would be to read the menu ahead of time.
Everything Is good here. I get pork and chicken, with the 50/50 tortillas, red and green sauce, both cheeses, slaw, and the green chile vinaigrette. This place will soon explode like chipotle!!

The green chile pork is amazing.  I would recommend the 50/50 tortilla and the green chile corn bread.  The cabbage slaw is super good too.  Only downfall is it's pretty small inside so if you head down for lunch during work, get there before 11:30 to avoid a line out the door.

Some of the best food I've had since we arrived. 100 times better than Caroline's, which has 4 stars. Everything here looks and tastes homemade, friendly service, and amazing choices. I just ate my leftovers two days after the original meal, and it might be even better! Highly recommended!

The food is amazing. If you are a whimp definitely go for the red enchilada sauce the green is a bit spicy. The meat is cooked to a perfect tender shred, the guacamole is excellent as are the chips. Tortillas are fresh and awesome, actually everything is! So glad I tried this place.

I finally took my first trip to Gadzooks and I will be back for sure! My sister recommended going early to avoid crowds, but I thought she was nuts because when we got there it was empty. By the time we left, the line was out the door! This place gets busy and the friendly, efficient staff is more than prepared to handle it.   We were greeted and the girl behind the counter explained the process to us - yes, just like Chipotle. Our pause was more just because there are so many choices! I went with 50/50 tortillas for my pork tacos, a little pico and sour cream and it was delicious. I wasn't hungry for a good 9 hours after that! Can't wait to try other varieties and of course, the enchiladas.
Good place. But their enchilada sauces are just to strong. I recommend get those on the side and add after as much as you need.
Excellent! Had the green chili pork enchiladas and was not disappointed ! Friendly staff, great atmosphere !
Delicious enchiladas! I saw all the great reviews for this place and had to give it a try, glad I did! I'll be back for sure!

This place was an awesome lunch spot. Service was helpful, food was fresh, quality ingredients, and great selection of toppings. I had the tacos, Green Chile chicken and the Modelo braised bison and I can embarrassingly say they were gone within minutes! I'll be back to try more from their menu.

One of my favorite places for lunch, it's only too bad there aren't more locations! 50/50 tortilla tacos for me, always add a third. One tomatillo chicken, one bison and one green Chile pork. Best. Lunch. Ever. Get the cheese melted over the tacos, side of the enchilada sauce, my mouth is watering just thinking about this.

Definitely a unique twist on the enchilada .... and a GOOD one at that.  We started with the Spicey Potato Corn Chowder and "doc'd" it up with some Guajillo Short Rib and a little jack and cheddar in a nice ceramic dish... to my surprise they put it in a little oven to finish of the soup... bam, deliciouso!!   My wife and split the two enchilada dish with the corn and flour tortilla mix (you can also get straight corn) ..one was roasted tomatillo Chicken and the other sweet and spicey cornbread.  Again we "doc'd" them. OTG up some delicious sauces (red and green) and a few more goodies... back in the oven and awesomeness. Great flavor and a great little place.   Will be back again!!
Super tasty enchiladas! I tried pork and cornbread filled, full of flavor. Guac is good too.

As a veg my review may contrast others.  This place is a chipotle of enchiladas. Pick your tortilla filling(s) and toppings.  For the veg crowd there are 3 ish choices, spinach and mushrooms (good concept but need a bit more flavor and mushrooms), pepper jack potatoes and corn bread. I have only tried the former two to date. For sauce there is only 1 veg option the green. top it with some cheese, melt it and then some salsa and slaw. Looks great.  The down sides are 1. lines quickly form as the melting of the cheese becomes a bottle neck 2. The taste is nothing special the green sauce and the soft tortillas makes this remind me of an Amy's dish 3. I was still hungry afterwards  Give it a try and see if it is your thing, for me my ~7 can be spent elsewhere.

Gadzooks is the bomb. It's close to my work so I frequent regularly. They are the makers of my favorite Tortilla soup and it's very reasonably priced to boot. The only caveat to that is you have to eat it there. If you don't, you will get a container of soup that is about 1/3 of the portion size of the in house one. So not very cool (or filling) if you have to take a quick lunch and cant dine in. That is the only reason I didn't give Gadzooks 5 stars, they could definitely improve upon that. Otherwise, love the place and the staff is very friendly.

AMAZING!  I went for lunch and got the 2 enchiladas.  One with green chili pork and the other with short rib.  Since I was a little overwhelmed with all the choices, and indecisive, I asked the person making it to top it with whatever went best, and that's just what he did.  I can't tell which one I liked better because they were both really good.  All I can tell you is, I will be back!
Amazing enchiladas! Just wish it was a little less expensive. The short rib is my favorite filling!

Stopped in at Gadzooks to see what an enchilada and soup place was all about.  Reminds me of a chipotle but with smaller portions and fresh made tortillas.  Everything I tried was great but there's were no condiments ( salt, pepper, hot sauces, eat.).   I found this a little strange for and enchilada shop.   If you heading there for lunch, get there early as it is a small place.  When I arrived there was one couple.   Within 15 minutes the parking lot was full and so was the establishment. If you get the chance I would defiantly check it out and decide for your self.  I for one will be back.
Great change to your regular lunch experience.... somewhat smaller enchiladas but loaded with flavor. Make sure to get a side of chips as the go perfect with the enchiladas!!!!!!

I love the food here! The tortilla soup is amazing as well as the corn bread. It's great, but I do have to say I think it's idiotic of them to charge an adult a dollar extra for a quesadilla that's the exactly same and a kids. I didn't ask for meat our anything special. My sister had asked for extra filling of cornbread in the enchilada, which the server.. then applied then scrapped off after. =_= some of the servers also seem to be mad sometimes, which is also bothersome. The only ones that have ever been nice is the blonde guy and the girl with gauges. I will be back with the hope that the guys make my enchiladas....

Best new enchiladas anywhere in Arizona, period. You get a dish of deep, cheesy bubbly enchiladas made the way YOU like it, and it is an absolute treat. Wonderful!  Update: after coming here for more than a year, the food is still ALWAYS consistent and delicious. I tell all my friends to come here and no one has been disappointed! Don't be afraid of heat, here: even the hottest salsa, "Habanero Lava", provides an appropriate heat with a pinch of deep, toasty flavor that really adds great dimension to the dish. Get funky wit' it and be sure to mix the fillings! Add cheese with chicken and spinach, or try the short rib with the jack potatoes. Yum!! Just writing this makes me want to jump back in line and order more!
Instantly became a repeat visitor to gadzooks after trying them the first time.  The homemade tortillas are awesome.  I crave this place all the time.

Food wasn't bad. Somewhat salty. The cashier was straight rude. I ordered Tortilla Soup when I got to the cashier and she annoyingly informed me that I should of ordered it at the beginning with my enchiladas. She then asked me what I want in my soup. I asked her what were my choices. She said that it was everything on the line. Again, she was rude and annoyed. I told her to forget it. I'll try it again but if they are rude again I probably won't go back

Love the place.  Have been going at least once a week for the last two months.  Their enchiladas are amazing and the stuffed poblanos are out of this world.  Only downside is that they sometimes run out of the poblanos. I learned to call ahead and make sure they'd have them on hand and they always will. If you're a first timer it can be a little confusing but they're quick to help and explain.  Always a great experience!

I saw a review that likened Gadzooks to Chipotle.  As I made it through the line and their staff assembled my lunch, I can see how that comparison can be made - in process alone.    I love that they have limited items on the menu (basically, enchilada, taco, tortilla soup) but then there's an option explosion for what you put in them.  I had a green chili pork enchilada and a bison enchilada.  Both were terrific. It was the best bison I've ever had, in fact.  The house-smashed guacamole was delicious also.  I thought I was smart by getting there at 11:30 (avoiding the noon rush) but they were already very busy.  I got the last parking space and the next to last interior table.  Thankfully the tables seemed to turn quickly and the line moved in the same way.  There are misters on the patio if that's your only course of action.     I will certainly come back and I'll bring friends.
YUM! It's like Chipotle's little brother. Great enchiladas and the soup is so filling it could be a meal on its own. Definitely worth a try!

This place has potential by the bucketfull. The front of house is really really cool, the menu is creative and well considered, the staff edgy but down to business. Talk about putting it on the walls! Just cool, in every regard.  Service was slow, not staffed well. Tables and floor, dirty. Flatware was empty, had to wait several minutes for a fork of all things.  Green chili pork enchiladas. Coleslaw, the habanero salsa. Coleslaw was the star of the show. Brilliant. Enchilada itself was middle of the road.  Braised short rib enchilada, red sauce, crema. Short rib was rich and tender, as it should be. The enchilada itself was left in the oven to long and the sauce was turned into a crust. I believe if it had been tended to correctly it would have been outstanding.  The staff was not friendly. Not a smile in the house. Like I said earlier, they were all business and nothing more. That having been said, when the rush was over they were cleaning straight away, which is good to see. What wasnt good to see was the skinny hipster guy coughing over his shoulder onto the serving station while he was sweeping.  Four stars for the great work done with the deco and the menu itself. I will stop by again earlier in the day and see if the concept is executed better when it isnt about time to close.

This place is overrated. It deserves two stars because they have a good atmosphere and idea but the food is not very flavorful. The tomatillo chicken was good and so were the chips but I would of rather had commercial tortillas than their fresh ones because it was not done correctly. The pork shoulder tasted like it was past it's use by date. I was really excited to try this place, but it disappointed with the lack of flavorful food, I might be willing to try the other location on camelback but the only thing I'd go back for at this location are the chips.

This place is amazing. I was kind of concerned because my husband is Mexican and typically very critical of Mexican food but this place rocked our socks off! My husband got the tacos and I got the enchiladas - both we're amazing! Thankfully we did our research and checked yelp and google before we went so we knew what we were in for.   I'd say this place is busy- know what you want as you walk in. Check out the gadzooks website and write out your order before you go. It will take 2 minutes but it will prevent the deer in headlights look as you struggle to create your meal  I had enchiladas -with half and half tortillas- 1 chicken 1 pork - Christmas style (half green half red) - with jack cheese- green sauce- crema and cotija. (Yep! 2 types of cheese! Boom)   My husband had 2 tacos - half and half tortillas - 1 chicken 1 pork with chihuahua cheese (cheddar) the habanero salsa and slaw  This place is 30 minutes from our place but definitely worth it. We will be back for sure.

I just tried this place for the first time today after hearing my co-workers Rave about it. I have to say I agree. I got 3 tacos made with the flour and corn tortillas which are delicious. Fresh home made Tortillas are to-die-for! I had one with the corn bread stuffing filling which was recommended by a friend otherwise I may not have tried it. It was so delicious!  It is very tasty and a little spicy. I also tried the smashed potato filling which was more mild but still good. And the third taco was with the spinach and mushroom filling which was my least favorite. The spinach and mushroom was a little limp for my tastes. I topped them all with pico and guacamole and a mixture of their two cheeses. I had them top it all with the crema sauce and their gadzooks buttermilk sauce. So so good! I will definitely be back. A couple of suggestions for the owners though. The spinach and mushroom filling seems a little lacking and a little wilted. Also the largest soda available for purchase is only about 16 ounces which is not enough for us in Phoenix who are usually hot and thirsty and want a large ice cold beverage. Overall this place is great and very unique!

This place has incredible food! it's an ingenious business concept that hopefully starts to branch out with more locations. If you're looking for an affordable, mouthwatering, and convenient meal this is the place to be!

I have been waiting ever so patiently for Gadzooks to open. I felt like that chic in the Mervyn's commercial standing at the window, saying "open, open, open." I drove by today and saw a parking lot FULL of cars. I quickly pulled over and ran to the door to snag a place in line.   It was totally worth the wait. They make the tortillas with fresh masa while you are in line, so it is totally fresh. The meat is incredible and the sauce is so flippin' delicious. I topped everything with pickled onions and a fried egg, my favorites.   I am a little apprehensive about this place opening though, because it is within walking distance to my house. I can feel my wallet crying already. I am going to be here often to try their other combos.

I'm surprised to see someone else noted in their review that they worked around people's allergies. I told them I was allergic to wheat (or gluten free) and they said they didn't have anything for me to eat. I'm not knocking them or anything, Just wanted to put that out there for others with a similar situation. Smelled good and looked clean, though. Love that neighborhood, too.

Gadzooks is a must-try spot in Midtown. They aren't afraid to add a little spice to their enchiladas and they use high-quality ingredients in every dish.   Get there before the lunch rush and owner Aaron Pool might treat you with a delicious and savory pumpkin cookie on the house.   This Chipotle-style process makes lunch quick and easy. Plus, you can add a fried egg to your dish for an extra surprise.   Gadzooks may have a silly name, but they take enchiladas seriously!

I came here sort of on a whim the other night as it popped up in a yelp search with good reviews.  I walked in not really not knowing what to expect. Lucky for me the guy behind the counter was amazingly helpful and walked me through everything. Not only was I given a rundown of how things work but also a really vivid description of the flavor profiles. I was really impressed by how helpful and detailed he was. This wasn't your standard run down of well chose a meat, salsa and toppings it gave me guidance of how things paired.  Using this guidance I walked out with an order of 2 enchiladas (one pork and one chicken) and the corn chowder with beef. I topped it with a bunch of sauces including a cilantro cream that was really tasty. I also added the pickled onions that really added some punch to the dish. These enchiladas were great and so was the chowder. While it may not look like much it was a filling meal, glad I decided to pass on the 3rd enchilada.  Only complaint was the the beef was a bit on the salty side but that's just me.  I will be back.
Their chicken tortilla soup is nothing but the truth. I was sick and that's all I wanted and they SURPASSED my expectations. I will be back...you can count on that.

I think I was over sold on this place, and that set my expectations too high.  When we arrived an elderly man exiting the building told us this was the best Mexican food he has ever had. I LOVE Mexican food both Authentic and "Authentic" but I just did not get this place.   From their website: "As I grew older and my tastes changed, I became unsatisfied with eating enchiladas that were the same color as construction cones and had the texture of a hot dog bun that had been dunked in water by a professional food eater."  I don't know where the owner was eating but that was never my experience at any decent Mexican restaurant.   The food was ok, and spicy but not in any kind of familiar way. It sort of reminded me of a TV dinner enchilada that had been churched up. My wife was not impressed as she thought it was too spicy, I thought it was not spicy enough. I'd love to tell you exactly what I had, but I just don't remember.  They definitely "redefined the Enchilada" but not in any way that I like.

Really, not great.  May have been because I got it to-go and I made 2 trips.  The flavors were good, but the enchilada was very soggy.  It was like soggy corn mash under too much guac and shredded pork.  It was a trendy concept that lost me along the way when I just wanted something good to eat.  I liked the sauce the put on top.  I also ordered the tortilla soup.  They gave it to me in a cup the size of a "tall" that you get from Starbucks that ended up costing me $5.50.  No tortilla chips on the side.  This wasn't "The Most Amazing Tortilla Soup" or anything.  Just regular tortilla soup.  I turned around and returned it because I was so angry for what I paid.  The Supervisor/Asst Mgr tried to say that tortilla was mashed up in the soup and that I have to request extra tortillas on the side.  I looked up the recipe, tortillas are not mashed up in the soup.  They give you a sizable portion, so if you think of the enchiladas as some sort of breaded shredded pork dish, it's tolerable the next day as a meal, but even then, there are a million places in Phoenix to get a great enchilada.

Tried the salad and 2 enchiladas. Was very good, thought it was good value for money. Ordering was a bit strange but I thought the servers tried to explain how to do it. It is a bit noisy inside though, if not, good experience and would recommend.
This place has the best enchiladas I've ever eaten. There's a red and green sauce that are both great- ask for Christmas to get them both. Don't forget to get a fried egg on top!
I was surprised at how authentic the food was here! Very yummy, a lot of options to customize the perfect dinner. Add a fried egg for a buck!

Loved it!!! My husband made a joke that I should never try new places hungry... boy I'm glad we did! Everything was sooooo good. My only 2 drawl backs were all the meat has some spice to it so the kids didn't care much for it. And the menu placement is odd, for a first timer I had to step back read, step forward and order... repeat. Highlights for me was the guacamole and pork! Next visit I'm having a grapefruit margarita! Now I'm super excited to the one opening closer to home!

This place is so good highly recommend there sweet slaw is amazing the enchiladas have a ton of flavor reasonable price there is always a line but it's well worth it and fast service makes it move through quickly very friendly staff

Love this place!  Great prices, great quality and delicious food. If only they had the 100 flavor soda fountain, it would be perfect.   So many choices and perfect size portion. Can't wait to come back and try other ingredients.

The hipsters behind this beautiful concept probably grimace every time the 'chipotle' comparison is made but it is a helpful reference point for the dining layman.  The concept is well executed and you'll be hard pressed to find a better meal at this price point.  My only complaint would be that they are excluding some of the better variations of enchiladas, namely Mole.

Dang it!! Came in Super Jacked to Love this place, saw Cory do a piece there on the News and it looked Awesome! Got there and was so disappointed....long lines which is expected for good food. But, NO VEGAN options- I checked the menu for my husband who eats Green for health reasons. It said there was a couple of options and then we are there- They aren't serving one dish so only one spinach option is available for him.  My nachos were good and I especially liked the corn bread that they serve- but it wasn't Amazing as it looked. Only 3 stars due to uninterested staff, and a establishment that had no clean tables to sit at- we had to bus a table to clear a spot in the place. It was more of a bummer cause I convinced my hubby to drive out of our way and then there wasn't any options for him. Probably won't return, there are so many options for this fare- nothing unique other than corn bread to brag about.
Great food and have good vegetarian options. Always busy  lots of great sauces to choose from

The enchiladas are delicious. As others have said, it is best described as Chipotle for enchiladas. If you are not a fan of Chipotle (I am), understand that I mean it as a compliment, but I am describing the process rather than the food. I ordered three enchiladas to try all the meats. I liked them all, but the short rib was far and away the best. I added the red sauce, both cheeses, hot salsa, guacamole, and sour cream. I look forward to trying more of the toppings, but the ordering process is a little confusing, so I went with what I knew to get through without much delay.

Gadzooks Enchiladas & Soup           "Just wasn't for me"   Gadzooks is a create-it-yourself restaurant with a hip and trendy vibe. Gadzooks offers enchiladas, tacos, chopped salads and house made tortilla soup. The staff at Gaszooks is accommodating, friendly, personable, and knowledgeable about the products they provide.  The atmosphere is stylish but very cramped.   I guess I was really expecting more, considering all the positive reviews I read and this is why I feel terrible for saying the food at  Gadzooks was bland and poorly executed. On my first visit to Gadzooks I had the two enchiladas meal. First you select a bread. I choose corn tortillas,  Next it was time to select a meat. I  went with the braised short ribs. After you select your meat your ready to add the enchilada sauce. I choose the "Christmas" red and green,  two distinct sauces. Then your creation is topped with cheese, and  there are a few cheeses to choose from. I tried the Chihuahua Cheese. The medium size deep dish is then placed into a brick oven to bake. I added a few extras like Uncle Rico's pico and scratch made crema.   To be honest the food just wasn't good. The enchiladas were bland and soupy. Even tho Gadzoooks offers numerous toppings, I think less is better. The enchiladas seem to be covered with as much cheese and sauce as possible and this took away form the flavor of the meat.  Gadzooks wasn't the worst food nor the best, just disappointing.      However ending on a positive note I LOVED their chips.

Great service and food. I'm a NYker that moved to the Valley of the Sun less than a year ago and finding good food here is hard. I live in North Phx and everything here is chain restaurants or food badly made. I went in with low expectations but was pleasantly surprise by their staff, food choices, prices and great service. I have visited this place three times already and am planning to become a regular.

Never disappointed. Such a unique and interesting variety of flavors. Built exactly to your liking. If you don't leave here full and happy it's your own fault. So good. In addition to enchiladas, tried the spicy potato corn chowder for the first time. Outstanding!  I come back every time I get the chance.

I love coming here.  The food is fresh and good and you can get in and out in 20 minutes (usually......not at lunch though, it is packed).  My favorite is the enchilada stuffed with a corn bread........it is so friggin good.  The guacamole is excellent and I usually hit this place up at least once a week.

This place is brilliant!   Screw chipotle! I order enchiladas at a Mexican restaurant anyway, so why not custom make them, in an assembly line fashion?   Delicious, vegetarian options, has beer, and something for just about anyone!

Very good food, nice atmosphere, a little pricey but ok.  I really liked the White sauce, but thought the Red sauce was a little too smokey flavored for me.  Employees were nice. I will definitely return.

After my initial experience here, the most immediate question in my mind is how well capitalized are their investors?  To the uninitiated Gadzooks appears to have been created to be as much a Chipotlé spinoff as possible.  From the hip, industrial design of the interior to the simplified menu options.  They've also borrowed Chipotlé's basic "build your own"  menu format.  Except rather than burritos - it's enchiladas... And as an afterthought soup.    While Chipotlé's menu is easy and intuitive, Gadzooks offers a 7 step choose your own adventure book accessed only by reading the most awkwardly placed chalkboard in restaurantdom.   The enchilada was bland.  The service seemed to be working awfully hard for so few guests.  The atmosphere was stylish but cramped.    I think these guys set out with a good idea, let's hope they have the capital to fix their fundamentals and get back on track.
Not the typical Mexican restaurant/food. Fresh ingredient for the more healthier minded person.

I had here what I think, in my humble opinion, was the most authentic and delicious gourmet enchilada plate I've had in my life. I grew up in Mexico and tried the lot. I've had from curb-side to high-end restaurants. This was quite a treat and this place takes the gold.  For a quick bite to eat I always resorted to stop at chipotles which was my favorite, until now. This place elevates Mexican food to a whole new level. The place has a similar feeling to chipotles, very rustic.  You can see the pots and pans being used to cook delicious meats that probably had been simmering all morning before opening. All the ingredients are fresh and they taste fresh. Crema from scratch? When a business is taking their time to make something as basic as crema fresca from scratch, you know you will not to be disappointed.  Enough with the talk. I encourage you to give this place a go. I know they have tacos and salads but they are a dime a dozen in this city. Not saying by this they are not as good, but good enchiladas are hard to find.
Booooooommmbbbbb!!!!!! Almost the same idea as chipotle being an American "Mexican" restaurant!

This place is amazing. I've been here twice and was surprised both times at how much meat they give you. The short ribs are excellent and the guacamole is perfect.   My only problem with this place is the girl behind the counter who talks way too loud. She's been there both times I've come for lunch. I get that it's noisy back there, but no one else behind the counter talks nearly as loud as she does and I hear them fine. I'm not letting this affect their rating though, since the food is worth it.

I really can't think of a bad thing to say about this place. I went with my parents and boyfriend as a sort of late birthday lunch. None of us had been here before, but we wanted something fast and casual, but still good quality. Well, that is exactly what we got.   As many others have stated, it's cafeteria style ordering. We all went for the enchiladas, but you can order tacos, salads, and soups as well. There were also a couple specials, including Modelo braised bison available till they ran out. We had our choice of corn tortilla or a 50/50 corn/flour combo. You then choose your filling, or a combination of fillings. I had green chili pork and the short rib, but there was also chicken, as well as potatos, spinach, and corn bread filling as vegetarian options, or to combine with your meat. I chose the cheddar cheese and Christmas sauce for both enchiladas. I also got a fried egg on top. After the enchiladas are baked, you can choose from other toppings such as pickled onions, pico, cotija, and other sauces and salsas. I kept it pretty simple and just got cotija and a side of salsa verde.   I ordered the Oro to drink, which is their house margarita. I honestly wasn't expecting much, as it came from a pitcher in the cooler, but it was actually really tasty. My mom got a ton of different hot sauce and salsa on the side. I was really happy with the spice level of everything. Even without extra sauce the enchiladas had a nice kick. The meat inside the enchiladas was tender and flavorful, and not fatty or too greasy at all. It was a perfect portion of food for lunch time, and we all really enjoyed everything.   Although we came just after noon (in the middle of their busy lunch rush) service was prompt and friendly. There was also ample seating, we found a spot easily and did not feel over crowded.   I'm glad we finally tried this spot out, I definitely would like to return and try other combinations on their menu.

All I can say is "WOWEEEEWOW!!!!! \(^_^)/  This place is set up like Chipotle, but that's where the similarity ends.  All items can be doctored up as much as you want with their delectable add-ones.  I opted for the tortilla soup option with 50/50 shredded beef/shredded chicken and added slaw, pickled onions and a little scoop of cornbread (don't question it just get it) plus a bag o' chips and salsa.  It was literally a party in my mouth with every bite.  Every employee I interacted with was pleasant and more than happy to help me figure out what to get since it was my first visit.  I will definitely be back during lunch for their specials!

They needed an extra employee or two. Dishes piled up on almost all tables. No silverware, and dirty tables and silverware holders. Recommend moving to plastic utensils and hiring a full time bus boy during peak hours!  Enchiladas were okay, but the short ribs were too spicy, overpowering. Took away from my overall enjoyment of their dishes. Otherwise  novel, yet Chipotle-like take on Mexican enchiladas and tacos. Half corn half flour was a  first for me tortilla-wise  It takes too long to order and prepare food here. I can actually get a Blaze pizza faster than this place makes my dish, and even then I haven't finished putting toppings on it. The assembly line needs modification somehow  Finally, the way the menu is laid out is preposterous. Unless you've been there before it's hard to read, and seems to be designed to 'read as you go's from station to station. They need digital menus here, visible to customers waiting in line, so you can know what and how to order before talking to a person  I'd try it again, this time chicken and no red sauce
Wife and I took the kids to lunch. Fantastic food at decent price. Three enchiladas, each different meat. Will definitely go back.

Fresh and delicious!  I went at lunchtime and had a chicken tomatillo enchilada and a green chile pork enchilada with corn tortillas, green sauce and habanero salsa, and a side of chips and guac.  I was a newbie and overwhelmed with all of the choices, so next time might load it up a bit more!  The food was very flavorful.  I will definitely be back.

Don't get me wrong, the Enchiladas are very good, but the menu item I will dream about is called Linda's Homemade tortilla soup.  Now as some may know, I am a soup lover.  This soup is more like a spicy chicken soup, although I think you can choose any meat to add that's on the menu.  Topped off with a bit of Jack cheese and crema and you have yourself quite a meal for $3.95.  Be advised, they get busy for lunch and you may wait awhile.  Service has always been friendly as expected.

So good!  I resisted going here for a long time (I don't like enchiladas or soup) but finally was convinced my husband to try it---it was great! It's kind of like chipotle but so much better, and it's not just enchiladas and soup. I love their chopped salad with short rib. My husband tried enchiladas and loved them as well. Service is fast & friendly, so much so that we stopped here (second visit) for a turbo lunch on my way to catch a flight for which I was already cutting in close. They sell beer even during lunch.  Convenient location. Will go back

I walked up and was like "wow! This place has a patio!" And let me tell you how dope that patio is! It's got like 7 tables! And you can sit at any one of them! Unbelievable. I'll be coming back to check out that dope patio for sure!

Mmmm. Enchiladas have always been one of my favorite foods, and there's a Phoenix eatery solely devoted to cheese-filled tortilla bites of heaven: Gadzooks.  For those of us who always dreamed of an enchilada bar, Gadzooks makes those reveries come true. The spot serves up just about any type of enchilada you'd like, as well as quesadillas, soup, tacos and salad. The tortillas are freshly made, and the combinations are endless.  Fillings include chicken, pork, potato, bison, mushroom, short ribs and two types of cheese ($6.50-$6.75 for two tacos or two enchiladas), and then you get to douse your order in salsa, sauce, slaw and more. You can order three, but two were plenty for me, and I left with a full, happy stomach.  The joint is order at-the-counter with a patio, and it's a really great alternative to Chipotle if you're looking for some new fast Mexican food. They also serve sangria, margaritas and beer.

For starters...WOW! I had heard great things about Gadzooks and been wanting to try it and decided I would make today the day I stopped in for lunch. They are set up a bit like Chipotle (how you order) but I don't care for Chipotle's food.... I had looked at the menu before going so I could think about what I was going to have before getting there. I decided to have two tacos. I choose the 1/2 & 1/2 tortillas (AMAZING) and one with the green chili pork shoulder and the other modelo braised bison, jack cheese (toasted) then I put on Pico, salsa verde, crema, honey slaw and jalapeno ranch. My first bite was the pork and I thought I had died and gone to heaven! The flavors were so good and everything was extremely fresh! The portion size was perfect as well. I cannot wait to go back and try more options as they are endless.

Best enchiladas ever. It's a chipotle style restaurant where you pick what you want on your enchiladas as you go. They give multiple options for enchilada fillings with the corn bread being our favorite. Putting a freshly cooked egg on top is a must. Extremely delicious and unique experience. If you are in the area, go check it out.

Uh oh. I'm in trouble. I work a mile from this place and I can tell from my first visit, I'm going to be in trouble. My coworker and I stopped in and told the guy making our food it was our first visit. He couldn't have been friendlier. He gave us suggestions and tips on what to get. We ended up with two chicken and cornbread tacos on 50/50 and nachos with chicken and Modelo braised Bison. Everything had so much flavor. And, I'm stuffed. Can't wait to go back to try everything else. YUM!
I really liked this place. Excellent cuisine. A lot of options to choose from. Fast and tasty. My only problem is that this is not a ton of food at a price. But in general it is excellent.

To me this is like Chipotle but for enchiladas. So tasty!!! You just go for it, get creative and then enjoy. My only star deduction is from the often crabby staff, specially if you come during lunch time.

Love me some Gadzooks! Favorite enchiladas are the braised short rib enchiladas. I usually get the short ribs on the green chili pork. Toppings are all fantastic as well from the coleslaw to the all the cheeses.   Pumpkin cookies are awesome as well. Great place if your looking to stay on a budget but still enjoy quality food.

This place was amazing. The line was rather long for lunch but they got through everybody quickly and expedited in the request that I have. The location is a little tough to get to but it's totally worth the parking fight for delicious food. It's worth the parking lot fight!

Ate here for the first time today. The shredded beef enchiladas were out of this world!  Probably the best I've had. Their ingredients are very fresh and they also have salads, tacos. Prices comparable to Chipotle but food is much better. Will definitely go there again with family this time.

Tried Gadzooks today at the end of the lunch rush. I think that young retauranteur Aaron Pool will have one of 7th Street's most booming places if he is able to work out the kinks.   The enchiladas were impressive. I would have praised them in a full sit-down restaurant and was surprised at the quality and flavor considering Gadzooks is a "fast casual" kind of spot. I can't comment on every element of my dish because I ordered in such a frantic manner. I do know that I had chicken and short rib enchiladas smothered in tasty, tangy sauce and cheese. Every bite and flavor was delicious.   The parts of the experience that were really lacking were service and signage. Though the employees were friendly, their knowledge of the product was minimal and sense of urgency was nonexistent. Just having the individual fillings, cheeses, toppings, etc. labeled would have cut down on a lot of the confusion. There is a chalkboard menu above the area where you order, but you cannot even read it unless you are standing five feet away. Places like Subway and Chipotle have had the same ten ingredients forever and people still have to hem and haw over their order.   I'm by no means suggesting that Gadzooks should go the Subway/Chipotle route. On the contrary. They boast the thousands of flavor combinations available, and that is much appreciated. Yet in order to follow through on that promise, they need to have a precise ordering process with staff that is knowledgeable about every ingredient and can convey that information quickly and effectively.   I'd like to see this place thrive, and I do absolutely recommend it. They've tackled the number one priority- good, quality food that is reasonably priced. Now they just have to work on the rest of it because a stressful ordering experience is enough to put people off the food altogether.
Finally moved to Central and Indian School...had Gadzooks for dinner my first night. So glad I'm in the area now, it's the only reason I moved here was to be closer to my enchiladas.

The enchiladas are great!  Read a few reviews and decided to try them today. They make the enchiladas right in front of you in a pizza type oven. Soo good!  Also had a sangria which was also very good. We ordered the soup just to see and weren't impressed - the veg in it felt like it had been in a crockpot for days. Everything else was amazing tho and will definitely be back

So disappointed since it's in my neighborhood. Interesting format but sloppy and disorganized assembly line. All the meats were super spicy, which paired with salsa, was way too hot. The tortilla soup remnants we had had NO TORTILLA, if there's no tortilla, its not tortilla soup! /end. The cookies were the highlight of the meal.  Now, they also have HORRENDOUS customer service! First off, no ice. I am so irritated that I will not come back again and will tell anyone who will listen how rude the blond cashier was. My sister had accidentally spilled our soup all over her hands and on the floor. No big deal, but not a single napkin in sight. When we asked for some, she returned with a wad of brown paper towels and then completely ignored us. Not a single staff member offered to replace our spilled soups or came to clean it up, just kept moving along as if they expected us to clean up the soup ourselves. I hate to think that it was a race thing, but their behavior was completely suspect. The manager came up to her to ask what happened, nodded, then returned to the assembly line. When I asked for a drink, she said there's no ice. But when she rung up this lovely young white couple, she said that they were making more and would bring it to them. WTF, I guess they don't want us black folks eating there.  P.S. This place doesn't hold a candle next to Barrio Cafe or Richardson's, what a joke.

Stopped by yesterday for some carry out to heat up later. Have to say the short ribs were amazing, the chicken was great, and the pork just OK. Topped Christmas style b/c the Hub prefers red sauce to my green - but this time we both switched teams. I found the red to be smooth, smokey, and complex - while the green was grainy and piquant with less kick than advertised - but he loved it. Liked the combo corn/flour tortilla the kid behind the counter recommended. Have to say at 4:30, the product in line pans were looking a little tired. Be nice if they were scraped down and cleaned up. Felt like it was lunch leftovers before the night rush. Which, at the proper temp is NP, it's just a mental/marketing thing...  Hey did anyone notice SOUP? Totally missed it in the 'experience'. Next time.

I'm a pretty big fan of this place.  Yes the ordering can be a little time consuming, but when you consider that by the time you reach the end of the line, you are handed over a freshly baked casserole chocked full of yummy goodness, it sort of makes up for it all.  So there are a few things you should know when ordering.  1) You can get nachos.  They're not on the board, but they will make them up and they are delish (and big).  2) The soup is awesome.  I wish they offered more than one size but it is tasty and built to your tastes, just like everything else.  3) The spicy cornbread filling should be nominated for its own food group.  This is seriously the best thing that I have tasted in a really long time.  4) The grapefruit margarita is fantastic.  Perfectly crisp and refreshing for our super-hot summer days, do yourself a favor and get one or two (or three).  5) The pumpkin cookies with touch of caramel frosting is a must have.  It is the optimal ending for the meal and since it's not heavy, it's a great topper.  The staff is friendly.  The space is clean.  The food is fantastic.  Yep, I'm a pretty big fan!

I think I have found a new favorite spot.   I had the roasted tomatillo tacos with a goat cheese shmear on the bottom, pico, guacamole cheddar cheese and a fried egg on top.   The first bite had the chicken and salsa and a bit of egg. Then I hit the jackpot with my second bite and was pleasantly surprised with the goat cheese and their guacamole. Each bite had a great mixture and these are tacos best eaten with silverware.   Their green chili pork looks very good as does they smashed potatoes which I will try on my next visit.  Staff was very friendly and once they knew it was my first visit they took the time to explain the process.   They also sell pumpkin cookies which are very similar to the ones my mom used to make. I may be biased but my mom's are better. Just a little more flavor than the ones I bought here.   All in all some hearty southwestern food that did not disappoint.   I will be back and anxious to try the green chili pork and smashed potatoes!
Very hot and spicy salsas and sauce. Get it it on the side add to taste/tolerance.   Can be noisy.   Overall - very good!

Arrgh, just when I kicked my Chipotle habit, this place comes along.  Some great tortilla soup, custom made enchiladas that come out of the oven piping hot.  Why didn't some one come up with this earlier?  My biggest gripe is the parking lot, not the easiest to negotiate a little parking lot on 7th street during prime rush hour but worth it.  Oh they have great snickerdoodle and Mexican wedding cookies for purchase right at the counter!
I love this place - enchiladas, soup and salads. The best filling is cornbread - even if you aren't a vegetarian it is worth it.

Have your enchiladas your way custom made to order! I love it here, you choose what you want and how much you want. This place makes enchiladas is a Chipotle like fashion where you point and add the topping you desire. You can have anything from mild to wild! The drinks are great too! The only bad part is the parking situation but that's also the part of the charm to this place also.

Wow, amazing food.  Tell them what you want and that's what you get. The Enchiladas are put together to your taste and the lava was for real.    Parking lot is too small and seating is a bit on top of eachother, so come early or take a late lunch.

I found a new favorite spot.   The service was great, letting me sample things before committing to anything, and above all, friendly.  The prices are amazing, especially the soup. It's been awhile since I've felt completely stuffed after spending just $4.50 anywhere that isn't fast food.   And most importantly, the taste. Muy bueno. Or should I say, "Gadzooks, that's good!"  I'll most definitely be going back.
They had me at buffalo enchiladas with Christmas sauce.  Their salsa is spicy and delicious!  Their handmade tortillas are very good.

I have to say this place is not what other YELPERS claim it to be. Definitely OVERRATED..!! Let me start off by saying this "Mexican" restaurant isn't Mexican whatsoever. I ordered my son a quesadilla aka cheese crisp & the flour tortilla was so thick and I'm assuming the batter had too much butter. Not sure how you can mess up a quesadilla. I myself ordered two enchiladas one four with chicken & the other corn with pork with green sauce. My first bite I thought yum as I continued to eat my meal I realized that the shredded chicken had similar texture to rubber meaning it was over cooked. I did not take another bite. I thought the pork was ehh ok. Later on that day my stomach began to hurt. I later felt nauseous'. I will never return here. Great restaurant concept but not what you expect it to be. Definitely a hipster spot. I almost forgot to add.... I always wipe down table before I help my son cut up food and let me say that the tables at this restaurant are filthy. The wipe was full of dirt. Made a dirt finger print on wipe. NASTY.!

So delicious!!! I drive by them all the time and finally gave it a try and now I'm obsessed  i used to frequent chipotle until they went downhill and this is my new favorite spot for yummy fast Mexican food! I've eaten here 2 days in a row and am still craving their short rib enchiladas. YUMMMM

I first tried the festival taco at Lost Lake festival and fell in love! I've been here 3 times after and still love it so much. The problem is everytime I come I feel as though the workers aren't very friendly, they aren't rude, just not very inviting. I ask for the festival taco and they continue to ask me what I want on it which confuses me because I want it just how it comes, I don't know exactly what's on it so how am I supposed to know? They don't speak loudly and I can't hear them. all in all food is always good, but the customer service just stresses me out. Make it how it comes and ask if I want to add anything extra, not ask if I want what's already on it. It's not just one specific worker it's ALL of them, just would rather have friendly workers who want to help, not feel like they have to.

A solid four star lunch. I knocked out their pork enchiladas that had their red and green sauce with a tasty egg on top. I went with their medium salsa which was good. The flavors were nice but in my opinion battled each other. For dessert, I had their pumpkin cookies and they were awesome. Overall, the food was good and I would recommend them over chipotle any day.

Take Chipotle and, cross it with wood-fired pizza minus the pizza, add your own personal twist then throw in some out of the ordinary choices (bison tacos, anyone?) and voila, Gadzooks.  You get to choose from soup, tacos or enchiladas and pick out your choice of meats and cheeses. After they stick it in the oven to get it all melty and toasty you add on veggies and our salas, perhaps grab and beer and your done.  I came not too long after it opened and it took a while to get my order in. A lot of that had to do with that fact that none of us really knew what our choices were. The menus aren't that clear so I found  myself guessing up to the last minute before making a rush decision as to not hold up the line any more.   It was a little haphazard behind the counter as well because the staff didn't quite seem to know what was going on or what they were supposed to do. It was like a poor assembly line that went horribly slow to suddenly speed up. It was like watching Lucy and Ethel make enchiladas.  Once i got my order though the meat was tender and delicious and I really enjoyed it. I would probably go just a little less melty next time. I think I need to go a few more times and become more acquainted with the menu I'm sure I'll like it even more. I'm sure too that by now that staff are more experienced and running like a well-oiled machine.

Not your usual enchiladas. Love their festival tacos!  One bite and it's like a fiesta in your mouth! They have such unique fillings for enchiladas and tacos!  Their guacamole and chips are delicious. They fry their own chips- wish they gave you a bigger serving of guac tho.  You have to try this place- it's unique and tasty.

Solid 4 star restaurant. They've never let me down, consistently good and I love the variety of toppings. I'm normally not even a fan of enchiladas, but these ain't your grandma's enchiladas. Every meat they have is good, and they even have vegetarians options of potatoes and cornbread as your filling if you're into that sorta thing. The cornbread is hands down the best cornbread I've had so I get a side of it every time I go in. You can't go wrong with any of the meats, they're all good. I can't even recommend one over another because I switch it up every time and enjoy it every time. Definitely a good spot to go and enjoy lunch any day of the week! My friends love the cookies they have so give those a try, I don't happen to like them, too sweet for me, but everybody else I know likes them! Enjoy!
Heard about this place and how good the food was. I ordered tacos and got what looked like enchiladas soaked in sauce which made the whole dish mushy. Won't be going back.
Excellent overall! Except for the Hispanic cashier she needs to cheer up! My favorite was the roasted chicken. I can't wait to go back for more!

Ate here for lunch on the great recommendation of a coworker who stated this was one of his favorite restaurants.   As many others have stated this is like Chipotle in that you pick your toppings for either nachos, tacos, or enchiladas. You can also get soup if you'd like.   I chose to keep it simple so I could really gauge the taste of my food. I chose one short rib enchilada and one chicken enchilada, Christmas style with jack cheese. It was quickly assembled and put in the oven.   The taste was great. The red sauce was thick and dark red, just how I like it. The green sauce could stand up against many New Mexican green chile and not be ashamed!   Now the short rib and chicken could have been a little more well seasoned, but I'm sure a dash or three of salt would have fixed it just fine. I like my stuff super spicy and well seasoned and most restaurants don't so I'm not knocking any points or stars off for that.   All in all this was an enjoyable eating experience and I'll definitely recommend it to others who are looking for fast and tasty enchiladas!
Gadzooks never disappoints! For people just trying it for the first time, don't be intimidated! Just ask for some help :) the workers are always so patient and have good suggestions!!!

Pros- Food is good. Lines are pretty fast.  Lots of toppings to choose from. The green corn casserole is amazing.  Cons- HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!! Push you through the line so you don't get to look much.  They are SUPER SKIMPY on the meat that fill the enchiladas.  Small place inside gets really cramped up. PRICES are way too high for the quality, I feel that's the biggest downside.....

I think it's great when an entrepreneur comes up with a new concept.  This whole idea of enchiladas and soup is really cool and I'll bet he opens several more locations.  I had the tomatillo chicken and modelo braised short rib enchiladas.  Red and green sauces, honey vinaigrette slaw, jalapeno ranch dressing pico de gallo and cojita cheese.  Super yummy!  I also had some chips, salsa and a beer.  Overall it was a great meal.  I'd like to see a little more selection of beer (craft) and the table I sat at wasn't bussed from the previous diner's mess until halfway through my meal.

This is the second time I've visited. The first time was lunch during the week and the line was out the door. After waiting for a while with three tired kids we decided to try it again some other time. I'm so glad we came back. The food is great. I tried the enchiladas- you pick your meat and they have several veggie options. I picked the short rib for one and spinach and mushroom for the other. I picked the green sauce and the salsa verde to top it off.  I don't get the fried egg, but the option intrigues me. It was love at first bite- so much flavor. I can't wait to try more combinations. The only downside for me was that the kids quesadilla was served in a really hot dish (not great for little fingers) and the guacamole served with the chips and guac is very small

This is hands down the best enchiladas I've had. The store is like Chipotle. You go in and order in steps. They put it in the oven to warm / let the cheese melt and then you get these gloriously cheesy and warm enchiladas. It's too bad that this isn't a chain. Totally worth going to.

I was driving by and figured I was up for something new.    The set up is bit like Chipotle for ordering, but the food is different enough to not be a facsimile of the other chain in any way.   The cornbread topping was excellent.  Get it!  The food and service were good.  Prices reasonable.  I went around 11:15am and there was no waiting.  When I finished the 11:30 lunch crowd was starting.  My impression is this place may have long lines at peak hours, so plan accordingly.

Great concept (bonus points because it was started by a young ASU graduate).  Tried the chicken and the short rib enchiladas with red and green salsa (Christmas style!), both kinds of cheese, pico, habanero salsa, and guacamole.  It was delicious!  It was pretty hectic/loud at lunch but what do you expect from a restaurant surrounded by businesses?  Also I didn't notice the "oversalting" of the food like some of the other reviewers but then again I love salt so who knows?  I will definitely be going back.

Stopped for lunch about two weeks ago. Wasn't quite sure what to expect but this place was really great! Went in around 1:30 so it wasn't super busy. I had no idea what I wanted and the employees were all super helpful and patient while we decided, I wish I'd have written down their names but I thought I'd remember... what I do remember is how awesome the green Chile chicken enchilada was! The tortilla soup was equally fantastic and I'll definitely be back for more! Great little patio too!

I love the idea of making my own enchiladas. It's my go-to when I eat at Mexican restaurants. This was so fresh, quick and delicious. I got the green Chile and chicken with Christmas sauce. Sides of the  potatoes and cornbread which I highly doubt  recommend. I will definitely be back

Great meal! 50/50 tortillas, genius.  I had shortrib enchiladas,  hubby had green chile and daughter had chicken. Great concept like Chipotle for enchiladas!  Good flavors wish there was one in California.  Definitely eating here again before leaving.

If you think you know enchiladas, think again until you try Gadzooks Echilads. Unreal, amazing options to build your enchiladas. Top five best eats in the entire Phoenix area. Sauces are perfect amount spice and savor, meats are premium and make sure to try the Modelo Bison. I can't wait to come back!
Enchiladas just the way you want them. Line was a bit slow (lunch rush) but the food was great!

I liked it. A little pricey but the selections were great, service prompt, and the meals were very flavorful. And they have beer.  My girlfriend and I went during her lunch hour on Wednesday and the parking lot was packed. We were served quickly on a buffet style line, and it was LOUD, it was a little tricky trying to figure out exactly how this place worked at first but only for a few seconds. I had bison taco's on full corn tortilla's, mixed cheese, baked and then topped with pico de gallo and some habanero sauce, My girlfriend had short rib enchilada's with 50/50 corn torts, asadero cheese, baked, topped with crema and pickled onion.  Despite the initial confusion and the crowd volume during the lunch rush, we both thoroughly enjoyed the quality and the speedy service. Will definitely be back and would recommend. Though it's best to be prepared and look at the online menu prior to arrival.

We enjoyed a great lunch there yesterday on their patio.  Ordering was difficult with the menu boards over your head but the staff was a great help with the dozens of options. The food was full of flavor, filling and  reasonably priced.

I love this place! It has a similar concept as Chipotle, but so much better. I first tried their taco at Hotel Thrillist last year and immediately fell in love! Pro tip: get enchiladas with the tomatillo chicken AND the sweet and spicy cornbread in the enchilada with green sauce on top - sweet, spicy and savory, all in 1 enchilada?! Sign me up! I also love how you can choose any toppings you want, which means you can customize your dish to whatever you feel like that day. Their toppings are phenomenal, and I usually like to get a little bit of everything- fresh slaw and pico de gallo, pickled red onions, crema, cotija cheese, and the Gadzooks buttermilk sauce (G SAUCE!).   You have to try this place.

The food was amazing and the options are so very unusual. Goat cheese on my enchiladas was a great addition.  The only drawback was the workers gave my lunch to somebody else much to my chagrin. But they were more than willing to correct the situation by quickly remaking my order, giving me chips/guac, and pastries. Wow! Thank you!

The short: The sauces/salsas and soup were too salty for me, some of the seating was tight, and the ordering process was a bit confusing or overwhelming for new customers, but the fillings were really delicious--extra kudos for offering several tasty vegetarian options.   The long: If you're new, I recommend you stand back, look at the giant overhead menu, and formulate a game plan before you walk up to the counter, because once you do, you walk under the menu so it's out of sight. You have to be quick, too, because the only place to view the menu without being in the way is just inside the door. I wish the menu were along the back wall so it could always be in sight. Every dish is built the same way, even the soup, which is why I was confused when the toppings I requested in my enchiladas started to be piled on top of my soup.   We ended up getting a bowl of soup with green chili pork shoulder on top (I'd meant for it to go into the enchilada and couldn't stop them in time before they plopped it on top of the soup) and four enchiladas: guajillo braised short ribs, sauteed spinach mushroom, smashed jack potato, and cornbread in corn tortillas. All of these fillings were amazing--flavorful, clean, fresh, and filling. The pork shoulder and cornbread were my favorites. The pork was so, so tender and moist--probably one of the best savory bites I've had in a long time. We tried both the red and green sauces and the pico and salsa verde. This is where the salt shriveled my tongue, pickled my guts, and hardened my arteries. The soup was also way too salty for me, and I couldn't finish it. I got a fried egg on top of my enchiladas, and that was a bit salty, too. For the most part, I was glad the tortillas protected the fillings from the sauces because I ended up just prying into them and eating the fillings about halfway through. My boyfriend agreed that it was pretty salty, but he managed to finish most of his meal and didn't say it was too salty to finish. Honestly, I want to say it was just my taste buds, but it was the saltiest food I can remember eating.  As for the ambiance, it's all right. Plain furniture and walls, brightly lit, and thankfully no loud music, but the chairs, especially near the window, were tight. After I sat down, someone sat down behind me and trapped me in so I had to scoot out sideways because I couldn't even turn around to ask him to let me out. I'd aim for one of the tables down the middle of the room next time.  We finished off by splitting a glazed pumpkin cookie--tender and cakey, and one I'd definitely eat again.  I do want to try them again, but until I know if either my taste buds or their kitchen were just off or I've just gotten too sensitive to salty food, I think I'll just top my stuff with cheese and get some salsa on the side.

Some people compare this place to Chipotle, and they need to stop. As someone who loves Chipotle even more than the proper amount, Gadzooks blows them out of the water.  All of the potential fillings for your enchiladas are flavorful. Like, not that silly chef's kind of flavorful that involves words like "light" and "delicate." These are some serious enchiladas with some serious, robust flavors. The spicy cornbread for example? It's actually spicy, and corny, and sweet. Also, you can get your enchiladas in chiles after 4:00 p.m. or some kind of delicious insanity. You can also add eggs, and they have a huge variety of sauces and toppings.   Just go here. I don't care if you're a local, native, hipster or old foagie. Ignorance is not bliss. Enchiladas is bliss.

The enchiladas were really good but the tortilla soup was just ok. I took my kid who is 7 and we had a little trouble finding something for her to eat. The gal behind encounter was very accommodating and made her something that she wanted. We'll go again.
Really great food - cornbread is a must!  Corn flour tortillas are the best.  Long lines during the week, get there right when it opens.
Innovative concept, surprising variety of menu options and fresh ingredients. It is a couple more bucks per person than Chipotle or Q-Doba but definitely worth it.

Seriously, how have you lived your life so far in the Valley without knowing about this place??? Best. Stuff. EVER.   My mouth is watering now as I'm starting to write this... Those enchiladas... yum... After we discovered it, we've been religiously visiting it whenever we can get a day off, early in the morning and you really need to get in as soon as they open, because the place gets packed and line forms around 11.30... which is 30 minutes after opening. Whatever special they have going on for the day, it's gone by 12... Soooo, yeah, get in early :D You won't make a mistake with whatever you try! The ingredients that they use and have to offer are just great and fresh all the way. And you can see them right there in front of you!  Do yourself a favor and get to it whenever you can!

In keeping with "Poor Review after one visit (why would I go again?) and a Good Review after at least two visits" I regret having to write this one after only one Review. I approached the experience with VERY high hopes. I let the "Server," who was extraordinarily helpful and very upbeat, decide what I should "try" on my first visit. He suggested:                One Green Chili Pork Shoulder Enchilada                One  Short Rib Enchilada  My Server covered it and after a bit of time in the Brick Over, added Guacamole and Crema (again his recommendation).  One problem, they both tasted identical. Couldn't tell the difference. I believe this stems form everything hot being kept in a steam table (ugh!) and obviously NOT freshly prepared. The taste was spicy but considering the amount of meat (a fairly good portion) I was surprised that the meat taste didn't come through.  The cost of over $9 for two relatively small Enchiladas I thought was a bit steep, but if the quality was better, maybe okay.  With so many good to great "Mexican" alternatives, wouldn't rank in my Top Ten by any stretch.  VERY disappointed!

Good concept, but falls short in some areas. Service varies. The cashier seemed confused the last time I checked out and was having trouble ringing up people's orders. I think the food is overpriced for what you get. It is very loud inside and seating is limited during the lunch rush. My favorite item is the pumpkin cookies with that brown sugar/butter glaze they keep by the cash register. Not a great sign when dessert is what you like best at a lunch spot. Fun to try, but will not be a place I frequent.

I was here at the opening bell on a Saturday with a group that took over about 1/2 the seating inside, and it was hot outside. The food was good. The folks working there were pleasant and knowledgeable.  I don't think I care for the assembly line in this case. It gets all bunched up because halfway through the process your meal goes in the oven but you can't just walk away because in a few minutes you have some more choices to make.  It does have parking which is a plus downtown.
It's good. It really is. But their vegetarian/pescatarian options  aren't great. In the end your enchilada is mushy with a weird menagerie of tastes. It's at least a one time visit.

Do you love enchiladas? I do! Just as much as I love tacos, sadly my family does not share the same love of enchiladas, so it's very rare that I get to have them at home. So when I heard about Gadzooks Enchiladas & Soup I knew I would be trying them out soon!   It's a pretty simple ordering processes, you pick your main dish (enchiladas, tacos or soup), what to put into your dish (protein choice, from veggie to meat) and how you like it topped (green or red sauce, or both) and what cheeses, then it goes into an opened oven to bake to melt the cheese, then you top it with some salsas and other fun items.  I went with 3 enchiladas, part flour part corn tortillas, and tried the stuffed poblano, sweet and spicy cornbread and roasted tomatillo chicken with half green & red sauce and topped it with some pico and habanero lava and had some creama drizzled over the top.  These were good enchiladas, very large and filling, the stuffed poblano was my least liked, it was the one lacking the most flavor but I was surprised by the sweet and spicy cornbread it was very tasty.    Definitely fulfilled my enchilada craving and look forward to going back!

I hate to be a downer on a local business, but given all the inflated reviews I needed to share our take... In theory, this place is amazing, local, and a lot of fun. The woman in line in front of us said, "Who would go to Chipotle when you have such a gem in the neighborhood?" I thought she must be right, but after my husband and I sampled our enchiladas and soup, we both wished we'd had chipotle. The potato soup was very salty, but I forgave them, because potatoes. The enchiladas just weren't good. Maybe it was an off night? Or maybe it was the intense pilling of sauces but our to go containers were ultimately just salty, bland, mush. There was no prominent flavor profile to be excited about, no texture that enticed me, and overall just nothing that made me want to finish my meal. The mushroom and spinach was all spinach. The red chile was more of a mole and than a traditional red chile. The flavor of the cornbread was tasty, but I barely got a taste of it because it was drenched in the green sauce, which was pretty bland. I really really wanted to like Gadzooks, but we ended up ordering a pizza afterwards because we were so shockingly disappointed in the taste/quality of our food. :(

First off...the food is fresh and hot.  Prices are very reasonable.  The tacos and enchiladas are amazing!  If you are in the mood for a quick lunch or dinner this is the spot. Very casual.  It is order and seat yourself style which isn't my favorite but the food makes up for it.

I've been wanting to try this place since they opened! Wish I would've gone there sooner! Being a beginner, it was a little confusing but they walked me through the process well. I chose to have the enchiladas one corn bread and one pulled pork and both red and green chili sauce. They were excellent I love enchiladas! So many choices it was hard to decide. They also have hand smashed guacamole which looked amazing. I will try it next time. You can choose to have street tacos or salad, but definitely Go! Now! Really Go!

This place is definitely the highlight of my trips to Phoenix! The concept is kind of like a Chipotle with enchiladas, except unlike Chipotle the flavors at Gadzooks are EXCEPTIONAL! First timers should definitely get the tomatillo chicken (I usually hate shredded chicken, but this was a major WOW for me) and the tortilla soup topped with the cornbread filling. The atmosphere is great with thoughtful minimal design details (they converted it from a gas station!) and their staff is super helpful -- everyone is very much on top of their game to make it a streamlined ordering process. My only complaint is that they don't have a location in California... yet! I can see this restaurant expanding and being very successful at anything they set their minds to. Kudos!!

5 stars for the food, let's be clear about that. The fallout comes from the inability by the staff to keep the place clean. Every surface of the restaurant is sticky. Tables, chairs, floors... There are more flies in this restaurant than on a camels rear. Please hire a bus boy asap.   No clean dishes or silverware. They handed us our food in the togo container and I proceeded to eat my enchiladas with a spoon.   Again the food is awesome. But this place has the upkeep of your local dive bar.

Seating is in short supply here!  There are also no misters outside for summer seating. Great flavorful enchiladas done Chipotle assembly style with a local Phoenix twist.  Multiple meat, cheese and sauce selections.  They are so great they allow you to mix and match!  I had the pork and chicken.  I loved the slaw add on, I don't see that often.  They also heat it up in a fire.  You also have two different style enchilada shells.  Staff is very helpful and guided me in my first time ordering.  I left with a hook up-enchilada style!  I'll be back soon.

Gourmet and great spin off from chipotle. The staff is always friendly and the cornbread is amazing. Plus what seems like a great selection of premium choices like braised meat, short rib, and all other flavors. Excited to see this take off and more locations open up closer to us.

So sad, went down here all excited to try based off the reviews, and the one chicken item they have, has gluten. Hopefully they can make an alternative chicken that doesn't contain gluten so more people can eat there!

I've literally eaten here 4 times this week.  It's a little expensive, ($22 for 5 enchiladas, an egg and two drinks), which is why I am stuck on giving it less than 5 stars. But otherwise, I think it could be worth the money considering how unique and customizable it is. I don't know, I just want everything to be free, so I'm at like 4.5 stars on this one...  Anyway, the food tastes great. Really unique, authentic options. I really recommend the red sauce, corn tortillas, pork, chicken, an over-medium egg, slaw, jalapeno ranch and cotija cheese...that's what I ALWAYS get. They have really good chips and salsa, too.  The staff is friendly. My only complaint is that there are SO many options, that I think they could benefit from having labels on the glass telling you what everything is, that way you don't have to stare straight up and get lost on the menu and waste their time, but they do a good job of explaining it anyway. Still, I like doing things myself instead of asking the same dumb question every time.   They serve in their own little wood-fired ceramic bowls which is cute and unique, too.  They said they don't like hearing "this is kinda like Chipotle!" so I will say this place is better than Chipotle, but very similar :)  They serve enchiladas, chopped salads, stuffed poblano peppers and have other specials.   Take all of my money, Gadzooks. You are so yummy.

The Meal.  The lava sauce was spicy: heat and smokiness; great stuff. The potato jack enchiladas Christmas style with Chihuahua Cheese and topped with freshly made sour cream was DELISH!  I enjoyed the oven where they heat up your clay dish holding your enchiladas; it is brilliant!  The only thing that I think could be improved upon, meal wise, is the corn tortilla itself.  The tortilla was too thick, which led to it unrolling while it was being prepared and while eating it.  I think if they were to make it just a little thinner, it would make the tortilla hold its shape better.  Service.  It's still their first week.  They were nice and ready to answer questions, but a little slow getting ready for the lunch time crowd.  It was fine, we weren't in a rush, but one thing to improve is have one person for each station.  While I was attended there were multiple people, some unsure where to go and what to do, and only a couple of people preparing the dish, which led to a bit of chaos and time delay in the kitchen side.    Ambiance. The place was nice, clean, modern, and casual. Love it! Especially the light fixtures! The patio outside was great!  Maybe one thing to consider is add a couple of those pavers from your patio exit to the north parking lot  along the gravel garden, you know to reduce people walking all over your rock and ruining the wonderful landscaping.    Portion. The two enchilada plate did not fill the stomachs of my coworkers, nor mine, we filled our cups twice with beverage and that held us over.  One of the guys did get a three enchilada plate with a drink and that did the trick for him.

SOO GOOD!  The food here is AMAZING. Big portion sizes and fresh ingredients. It is set up similar to a Mod Pizza or Chipotle where you build your own enchilada. They have tons of toppings to customize your enchiladas at no extra cost.  I will say that every time we have come here at lunch they have messed up one or two people in my group's order. They need a better system when it comes to putting the enchiladas into the oven. (Maybe some way to mark the dish?) Seems like the people at the front half of the process get too far ahead and before you know it they are losing orders/adding red sauce to the wrong order, etc. I hope they can streamline this process a little better.  Still a huge fan! The food speaks for itself.

The concept here is like a higher end version of Chipotle but with enchiladas rather than burritos. They have multiple vegetarian options, which is refreshing, and they are delicious. One is a spinach and mushroom combo and the other is mashed potatoes with jack cheese, so more than just your normal cheese enchilada or rice and beans.

Check out this hipster spot!  The Enchiladas are not your whole in the wall variety.  You can customize the inside, outside, and aroundsides on this bad boy.    Great concept, great food.  Can't wait to go again.

If I lived in this area I could easily see this place being a regular spot, but with so many options, it may be a while before I hit this one up again.  I'm just gunna call this gourmet enchiladas. Delicious enchiladas. It's not a dining experience, but good for a one hat show.

I am in love with this place!  Positives: You walk in and choose what type of meat,sauce,etc in a line.  They assemble your dish as you watch,  not realizing how delicious they truly are til you take a bite. I recommend doing 2-3 enchiladas and mix the sauce(red and green)  You choose everything you want to add in.    I wasn't expecting amazing but it certainly was.   Negatives: Nothing really!
