It's a smaller place but we had no problem finding seating. I suppose during a busy time it could be snug.   I will definitely be going back.

Came here fr a nice dinner date wt the girlfriend nd was not dissapointed.. The tacos were great as well as the enchiladas.. Definitely try this place out if ur in a mood fr a good meal.. Not to mention the pumpkin cookie wt the maple cream topping..
Discovered this place last year and I'm in love. Build my own enchilada watch them cook it in a open stove. Top it with many great toppings and natural ingredients! Delicious!

I went during their opening week and despite the obvious challenges they faced while learning a new restaurant and concept and staff I went back because the food is off the hook good and cheap as hell.  Both times I got the half and half tortillas, I like the softness of the masa. I also got the chicken and short rib. The chicken is light and flavorful, the short rib is hearty and savory and smoky.  I chose the "Christmas" sauce, half red, half green. the green is fruity, light and refreshing while the red is super smoky and hearty. I like the red better and need to remind myself for next time but the two together make a nice contrast.  I got the cheddar cheese and then the guac and pico with the habanero on the side, its hot, and I mean hot. What I think is hot most people cannot eat. To me the habanero is edible but if you use too much you could ruin the meal.  My friend got the chicken and the mushroom and loved both. He also tried the jalapeno ranch dressing and it was awesome ( I stole some).  The first time we visited was their opening week and the wait was tough, the food ran out, the staff was over their heads.  This time the wait was non existent, the food plentiful and fresh and the staff orderly and efficient. What a difference a few months made!!  Some people complain of "chipotle with enchiladas", and the resemblance is there in the production line and the mexican flavor but thats where it ends. With the huge amount of choices and customization as well as the food being 10x as flavorful this is the clear winner.  The food is as flavorful as Richardsons or Barrio Cafe. no joke.  I am glad to see they worked out the bugs.  Eat here. Again and again.

Despite rave reviews from other Yelpers and friends, I found my Gadzooks experience tonight fairly average. Now, my choices were more limited as a vegan, but I was looking forward to the spinach-mushroom tacos. I topped them off with Pico de Gallo and guacamole. We also ordered the chips with the roasted Roja salsa.  The corn tortillas were outstanding and held up so well to the filling. I found the sauteed spinach-mushroom combo to be okay, not anything too flavorful. The guacamole needed something more, in my opinion. If I am going to eat guacamole while visiting AZ, I have high expectations. I thought it was bland. The chips were also okay. So, my meal was good but nothing that would bring me back in a hurry. I will say the enchiladas looked delicious. Worth a try if you are in the area, especially for cheese and meat lovers.
This place rules! Enchiladas are great. Short ribs and Modelo braised bison! Gotta get there during lunch for the bison or they'll run out. Excellent food and good Mexican beer

Gadzooks. Mm.  Words can't describe how amazing the food is here. It's basically a place where you make your own enchiladas in a serving line type of ordering style similar to Chipotle and Qdoba.   You start with their own half and half corn/flour tortilla, or just a corn (get the half and half)...and then you choose your fillings. They have braised beef, green Chile pork, chicken, and some other fillers like potatoes, and a corn bread thing that is bomb.   Then you pick you enchilada sauce, your cheese - then they throw it in an oven behind them and let the cheese get all melty. After that you can top it with their honey slaw, cotija cheese, sour cream, jalapeño ranch...a FRIED EGG....a bunch of good stuff. It's amazing.   The service is pretty good, all the staff is friendly. Overall, if you like enchiladas or Mexican food in general, you should definitely try this place.

Pretty good! This was our last meal before leaving Phoenix and I'm glad we picked this place.  Like others have said, it's Chipotle-style so you build your own bowl. I ended up going with a salad and my boyfriend got the enchiladas. I was pleasantly surprised at how good both were. The enchiladas were sloppy, flavorful, perfect. My salad with fresh romaine was chopped after adding all the ingredients I picked and tossed in the dressing altogether. Specifically I remember asking for a ton of pico de gallo, corn, broccoli/cabbage slaw. I got the shredded chicken and a jalapeno-based dressing which was pretty spicy.  I got a side of the corn bread and it was so delicious. It was more of a warm pudding and was slightly sweet, plentiful corny, fluffy, decadent, slightly burnt on the edges, with just the right amount of kick / spice.

This place is a new building with a small parking lot. The look was fresh and new, I just didn't like the chalkboard menu, you have to tilt your head back to view it all, wayyy back. The inside seating isn't that huge but they do offer additional seating outside. With the nice weather (73F) it's not to bad...for now...  I ordered the 2 enchilada's with corn tortilla, 1 pork and 1 chicken. The chicken tasted like I could've made it at home, and thats not a compliment. The pork was much better. I got green sauce on top with cheddar cheese. After they stuck it in the fire stove and melted the cheese, I asked for the hottest salsa (a red sauce), pico de gallo and a side of the cabbage stuff. Don't know what the cabbage was exactly called, but that was delicious. Just those two were enough to fill me up. I don't eat enchilada's that often and when I do, its pretty basic. But there was so much options that my choices didn't actually come together. That doesn't take away from the place though.  Next visit I'll try the beef and the mushroom spinach enchilada. They also have bison, but I'll take a pass on that. What I thought was interesting was when you go to pay, they ask if any of the food items is bison, basically going off the honor system of you telling them it is or not. When I walked in there were about 6 people in front of me. When I sat down, there was 20 people behind me. The cashier was talking to another guest and she was saying that they are always packed. So plan to wait.  What annoyed me: The bathroom's are locked. I guess you have to ask for the key, not sure since I was annoyed and decided to hold it. lol The "service line" wasn't at their best. The first guy was making fresh tortilla's and when he put my tortilla's on the line he decided not to keep going and put the meat in.(He did for the guy in front of me, I guess because there was no one behind me?) He could've finished IMO. The second guy was in charge of meat and cheese...thats it...he could've assisted the third person - she had to pop them in the oven, finish the topping THAN check the customer out. He didn't move....that would've pissed me off if I was her. While waiting for my meal to melt, one other person appeared from the back and stood at the beginning...but no one still bothered to help the last person.  What made me happy: They had cream soda. lol

I went here based on yelp reviews.  Summary:  Cheap, quick meal with the same concept and price as Chipotle but enchilada style.  You pick flour or corn, what type of fill, what kind of sauce, cheese, toppings, etc.  They heat it up for you and you are good to go.    Here are the issues I encountered:  I went here with a friend and we had no idea how to get started so we kept reading the chalkboard(s) to figure it out.  The first person on the assembly line was extremely rude asking questions as if she was annoyed.  Can't she freaking tell we have never been here before and we have no idea what the hell we are doing?  Then, the next person - same thing.  The guy asked me what type of sauce, what cheeses, toppings, etc and seemed annoyed.  Last position - the cashier.  We had asked for the meal "to go" as I usually expect to not eat my whole meal even though we were planning to eat there. I tell her that we plan to eat there even though we ordered "to go" and she too had this annoyed look on her face.    My friend and I started talking about what just happened.  He asks, "Was it just me or did it seem like they were annoyed with us?"  We then start watching the assembly line with other customers that came in after us to see if it was something with "us" or in general.  So of course, the first batch of customers walk up the assembly line.  The worker starts asking the customers if they have ever been (and they have not). She starts explaining how it works, etc.  So it was a completely different treatment.      The food was ok.  They could of heated the enchilada a little bit longer.  However, based on the customer service, me thinks not.

Our 1st visit was amazing. Had different enchiladas. Pork shoulder, beef short rib, & chicken. Also tried tortilla soup with pork shoulder. All food was amazing!!! Can be a bit spicy for those sensitive to spice, but it was perfect for us! Topped off dinner with sangria & a margarita! We will be back.
Really good food. Clean. Cheap. Friendly. Win.

Several reviewers mentioned that the spinach & mushroom filling is vegetarian. If Aaron Pool makes it the same way that it's listed in the recipe he share with the Arizona Republic today, it is NOT VEGETARIAN (chicken stock).  I am shocked that several reviewers (who are vegetarians) seem to have had staff members steer them toward this option, despite the fact that it is NOT vegetarian.  Really? Why not just use vegetable stock? And if something seems veg, but is not, please tell your staff.  Here is the recipe that Mr. Pool shared: http://www.azcentral.com/story/life/food/recipes/2014/04/22/spinach-mushroom-enchilada-filling/8013227/

Don't expect "authentic" on this, it's their own twist on enchiladas, that's not necessarily a bad thing. I had the green chili with bison, they were very good, although it's hard to reduce the acidity in the tomatillos, other than that you just have to add the right toppings. This joint uses a method similar to Chipotle's; everything is in front of you, which is good!

Awesome Amazing service Starving and this place made me smile Got the two enchilada one with green chile pork the other with short rib And their chicken with corn bread taco This place exceeded all expectation

I've been watching this place under construction for a while, and was glad to have the opportunity to pick up a late lunch to go today.  I wanted to try a variety of their options, so I got a 2 enchilada plate with chicken with green sauce and short rib with red sauce, as well as an order of chips with hot salsa on the side.  The food was fantastic.  I was a little skeptical of how they were going to pull off the cheese part in a to go order (my favorite part of enchiladas is the melted cheese on top!) but by putting the enchiladas in the oven right in a foil to go dish, the cheese was melted perfectly!  Both meats were tasty and high quality, and the sauces were savory and amazing.  The chips were clearly homemade and the salsa was plenty spicy but also flavorful.  I took off one star for an ambiance issue - it was SO loud in there with all of the stone/metal surfaces that it was hard to hear and speak to the line cooks to place my order without shouting and leaning a bit toward/over the super high glass partition.  A little bit of insulation for noise reduction would do wonders.  I can't wait to go back and try the cornbread and mashed potato enchiladas, as well as the chicken tortilla soup!

GREAT food-- in massive amounts! The setup at Gadzooks is kind of chipotle/ subway style; you walk through the service line and tell the servers what you want in your enchiladas/ tacos/ etc, pay, and take your food to your table. I was kind of overwhelmed by the number of options, but the staff was mostly helpful and the food was ready in no time!  I had a spinach and mushroom enchilada and a potato enchilada with an egg on top. I would highly recommend the potato; it sounds like a weird combination but is really good! I was so stuffed, I wish I had only ordered one enchilada. I also had the grapefruit margarita, which wasn't that grapefruity but was nice and refreshing. We added on an order of chips and guacamole. The chips are amazing, but we only got a tiny serving of guacamole, which was kind of disappointing.

Ok- I'm from SD so Mexican food is hard to please as we have a ton and are right next to TJ! Ordered via post mates and honestly wasn't expecting much. I was so pleasantly surprised! It's kinda like chipotle you add all the toppings and such that you want! Very flavorful & pickled onions were yummy. Salad was slightly over dressed but I think it's because I added everything on the menu haha. Will come again when I'm visiting and do recommend you check it out if you are on the fence!

This is a great place to go either by yourself or with one other person. Somewhat difficult to order and sit with a group, especially when the restaurant is busy.   Food is really really good, though.  I got 2 enchilads with the green chile pork, red sauce, over easy egg, and guac. Definitely worth the additional cash, I t hink.   Overall the atmosphere of this place is decent. It's like the chipotle of enchialada places which is nice. Nothing that sets it apart, really.

Saw the google review pics of this place while researching food in the area.  I had just finished eating, and I was STILL drooling over the pics!  Had to try it, and just did.  This place makes some great eats!  Awesome flavors and combinations.  Will be back!

I can't even ... We had several locals recommend coming here so we did, and it blew away an expectation I had. We had the fiesta tacos, and they were delicious!! So so good.  The server forgot to give us our guacamole and when I went up to get it I mentioned that my food was eaten and asked what the price of tortillas is. It was too expensive in my opinion for an error on there part...I had hoped they would discount or comp them since it wasn't my fault. Having said that, the guacamole was delicious! Yes, it would have been better on my taco, but I'm not mad about it and I would go back again.   @trailmixandchocolate

I've been twice, and I've loved it all. I recommend the enchiladas with potatoes and cheese, and their s'mores cookies are fantastic!  Edited to change from 4 stars to 5: their nachos give me lifeeeee!

I've been to GadZooks a few times. I go here when I want an enchilada that's got a little extra something. I love being able to customize. And they have an overwhelming number of options so I recommend going with someone who can suggest something to get you started. (I need a lot of time to take in all the options which doesn't work if you're eating with other people.) anyway I had the cornbread in my enchilada. (It sounds a little weird but it's really really good!) I've tried both the red mesquite sauce and the green sauce.  I thought the mesquite was too hot for me but it was really good if you like that.  I haven't had any issues with service.
Great food and service. It's my once a week place for lunch. The short rib is packed with great flavors and the tomatillo chicken also tasty.
Pretty good lunch. I ordered two enchiladas and tortilla soup. I filled my enchiladas with bison and pork and chose the "hybrid" tortilla. Everything was good, but nothing to write home about.

Quick, tasty and always on point! This place is very efficient and always clean. Favorite would have to be the chicken tortilla soup but the pork tacos and mashed potatoes are definitely up there as well! We usually stop here for a quick bite before heading over to Taco Guild across the street.

I love love love Gadazooks. Their half corn/half flour tortillas are phenom and their green pork chili is fantastic. I tend to get the same thing every time I go but I know the enchiladas are phenomenal and I will try them soon!
One of my favorites. Imagine Chipotle at much higher level with the best possible ingredients. Love, love this place and crave it a couple times per week.

I was excited to see an enchilada and soup shop open.  Soup... not soups... they only serve one kind. The food is flavorful but the process is difficult. The staff appear grungy and have no sense of urgency. It's concerning they don't wear hair nets. One of the employee's pants had grease stains and the t shirts on the gals were grossly form fitting. Just not what I expect when someone is making my food.   I've been twice. Once when they opened and again a few weeks ago.  Both times they were out of something on the menu.  The concept of a string tying machine is interesting but completely a waste. It almost seems as though they rushed to open and skipped on important details. I truly hope the owner reads these reviews because the food is good and the place has such potential. It seems like there are too many employees on shift which makes for a complete social hour.  I drive by every day and am starting to see an empty parking lot. I hope the owner acts on just a few of these issues. It would be a shame to see this place close needlessly.  PS... It appears another taco shop is opening up across the street. Please take action and make it easier for patrons to support local business.

OMG is all I can say. Absolutely delicious. I took the employees advice and did enchilada style short rib and pulled pork with Christmas sauce. I wish now I did the fried egg on top. The slaw and pickled onions are just the right toppings. And to finish off your meal you must get a pumpkin cookie. Definitely recommend to all.

This is a place I have drove past a dozen times, and today I finally stopped in. It was as good as the hype.  I kind of resent that it get compared to chipotle, its a similar set up but the taste is far supiror. I had two tacos one Chicken one beef, meat had so much flavor, and I could probably eat a whole plate full of those pickles onions. The soup was amazing as well.

The Chiptole of enchiladas. You come down along a line and pick what kind of tortillas you want, meat, sauce, etc. I felt as though with so many options the enchilada wasn't perfected. I only came here once, and probably won't be returning. I you are looking for quantity, in terms of kinds & types of enchiladas, then this is your place.
Love this place.  Soup is wonderfully fresh, filling, and flavorful.  I only wish they offered black beans.

I came in here for the first time a few weeks after it opened, during their lunch rush with my dad. It was definitely not what I was expecting, instead it was a Chipotle like make line for enchiladas, tacos, soups, and salads.   I immediately felt trepidation about the quality of food, and guilty that I was making my dad deal with a jam packed place that might not even be good.  The first bite I took of their green chili pork enchilada eased those worries in a heart beat. Even my dad, who hates crowds and considers himself a foodie was applauding every bite of his red chili enchiladas.  Flast forward two years and this place has remained just as utterly delicious as the very first time. Ive brought more friends and family since, tried each of their meats and even an amazing potato hash option they have. Everyone I know absolutely loves this place, especially if they came early enough to try the bison which is only served until 2pm.  When its not lunch hour, or you stop in during the weekend, the place is spacious, with plenty of seats inside or outside on their large pet friendly patio. Its a perfect place to have a relaxing lunch, grab a cervesa, and chat with friends or family. Especially since after two enchiladas, you barely want to move!  As for suggestions, I'd say definitely try the rib or bison if you get the chance, order one of their delicious cookies, and dont be afraid to try all their amazing toppings, there's no going wrong here and they'll even add things on the side if you're nervous about liking something or not.

If Chipotle and Los Agaves had a baby her name would be Gadzooks. Simple and affordable yet exotic and delicious. A mouth-watering explosion of flavors!  Can you say gourmet fast-food?  So many combinations of yumminess at your disposal and for you to create.  There was no line and a huge overwhelming chalkboard featured an array of fabulous fixings. It was too much to absorb, taste-bud overload.    Sauteed spinach mushroom,  creamy goat cheese,  Jalapeño smashed potatoes,  guacamole,  spicy cornbread hash,  hand-made corn and flour mixed tortillas,  6-8 types of chili sauce...wow!  You start by choosing either an enchilada or taco or a combination.  I chose two enchiladas.  Then choose your fillings: like  shredded pork,  shredded chicken or  shredded short ribs,  you choose a red or green sauce and you have various topping to choose from like:  vinaigrette slaw, creme, cotija cheese, pickled onions, hot sauce for more spice like pico or lava (habanero).   Then more "dressings" like:  buttermilk,  honeysuckle vinaigrette or  jalapeño ranch.   You can dress your dish anyway you want.    If your order is "to stay" your enchilada is placed inside a clay pot and put it in the oven for all the flavors to melt together.    Thirsty? Great choices for drinks too:  Margarita,  Sangria,  Mexican Beer,  Trendy Sodas   I topped my meal off with a Pacifico Mexican beer and a lime. MMMM  I don't like tip-jars but I tipped here. The staff is friendly helpful and they bus they tables.  Don't forget your pumpkin spice cookie for dessert!  A cake like soft cookie decorated with a simple sugar frosting.  MMMM perfect ending.  Thank you for staying open past 9 p.m. (closes at 10 p.m.)   Outdoor patio seating available.   If you haven't been here what are you waiting for?

I like this place a lot. I want to love it more, I really do but there are just some things that I've noticed in the few times coming here. Number 1 I love the cornbread it's excellent. But when it comes to ordering it's really hard to  communicate between the really tall thick plexi glass of what you want. Also, I think it would be nice if you could label what we are looking at behind the glass because for the first timers it's hard to tell what each little container has in it. You can only really kinda guess by glancing at the menu and then glancing back at the toppings to kind of guess what each one is. This takes up time and holds up the rest of the line from moving quickly.

Gadzooks, for me, was somewhat boring.   I was taken to Gadzooks for lunch, with a couple of friends. We had heard that the food was great, so we decided to test it out.  The menu was/is confusing, too many sauces. Choosing the right combo seemed just like an unlikely happening..  Overall my food was bland and unimpressive. We all almost left half of our food on our plates.  Staff was great, friendly. Helpful and knowledgeable.   3 stars just for the fact that the staff was pretty much the highlight. I probably won't return. I just really wanted to like this place.
I'm a huge fan of tortilla soup and the fact that I got to add braised beef to it as an alternative to chicken was awesome!
Tried this place for the first time tonight and it was amazing! Everything was flavorful and the staff was really helpful! I will definitely go again. And again.

This is our go to place when we are in the Central Phoenix area.  We usually go for dinner and it's usually crowded.  Today for an early brunch, it was not too busy.  This was great because we always feel stressed out ordering because there are so many options to choose from.  I recommend the two enchiladas, on 50/50 mix tortilla with a mix of pork and cornbread, or pork and mashed potatoes.... I know, sounds super weird, but it's super good.  I get all the toppings and when I remember, I ask for an over easy egg.  I usually get the super spicy sauces, and they are spicy, but not overpowering.    The food is excellent and the service is top notch as well.    Why not 5 stars?  Complicated menu that gets easier when you go frequently, and you can hardly hear the employees because of the glass barrier.  Excited to see they have a location on Camelback now. Will have to try it as it's closer to my North Phoenix location.

I'm big on Mexican soups, I failed to realize that the word soup in the business name was singular. Only one soup offered here "Tortilla Soup" I didn't try it. I had the spinach & mushroom enchilada, with an sunny side up egg. It was delicious.

This place makes really good food. It is like the enchilada version of chipotle and definitely worth a try if you're in the area. You have just about any combination you can think of. And the mashed potatoes are sooooo worth it.

Went in for lunch and got two tacos - one chicken, one pork. The menu is a little confusing and you're stuck gaping at the chalkboard on the ceiling while the workers stare at you, which is weird and not too flattering. I'd much rather have the choices on the glass in front of the toppings and myself or a menu on the side wall, so I can just pick what I want down the assembly line without having to listen to the explanation of each. I'm not a fan of Chipotle and didn't realize this is basically the same concept.  As mentioned in other reviews, they didn't bake the enchiladas (my mom's choice) very long. I also had my tacos baked to melt the cheese which was a nice option. The tortillas were VERY good (we got the lard mix), the meat was a good quality and tasty, I liked the cabbage mix also. I added guacamole for $1 but it was little too spicy for me - most people would probably like it. The tacos were STUFFED and overall really good. I didn't try mom's enchiladas because she said the green sauce would be too spicy for me (I'm a wuss when it comes to spice, what can I say).   Two plates with a soda for just under $20. Not the most cost effective lunch I've had, but seems pretty standard. Would love the menu location change/expansion, longer oven bake time, and a way to buy those tortillas to go.

This place is very adorable and affordable! It tasted great and was filling. I recommend the sweet corn bread in a corn tortilla... It was so flavorful and unique. I will definitely be back! Happy eatings :)

The food is bomb. I usually get short rib and chicken enchiladas with both sauces. The service could be better. The cashier swiped my card, gave it back to me, then walked away. I wasn't sure if the transaction was done or not.  I literally had to ask if it went through. No "thank you" or "have a great day!" I personally don't care about bad service I just want to know if I can leave and eat my food lol

This place is a MUST-TRY!   It looks and feels like a Chipotle when you walk in the door, but with a tad bit more edge and freedom. The enchiladas here are amazing!  I ordered two enchiladas  (beef and pork), smothered "Christmas-style" (the New Mexico way and the way God intended!), and topped it with fresh crema, cheese and hot (truly hot) habenaro chili sauce. Sooooooooo much flavor! Really kicks you in the taste buds and takes them for ransom! Amazing! Definitely coming back!  I also purchased some cool looking cooking at the counter that turned out to taste like pumpkin and I almost had to cut my "friends'" hands off for trying to steal them. Delectable!
This was soooooo good. Think Chipolte style but enchiladas instead of a burrito. Incredible mix of fillings. I'm so Impressed. I wish there was one in the East Valley

Thank you Yelpers for helping on this one.  For my first night in PHX I wanted Mexican but was not sure of just where. I stumbled on this place with the guidance of Yelp.  I was smart to look online in the parking lot to check out the menu so I could get a feel for how it worked, what they had etc. This was a good move, the menu is a chalkboard that is about 15' long and above the counter so you feel like you are trying to look for Haley's comet while reading the menu. This is not a criticism just an observation.  Now the food, this is high end Mexican fusion. You pick everything to make your custom enchiladas. The meat the sauce you name it everything is yours to choose. And it's really hard as they have VERY good ingredients.  I went for 2 'ladas 1 green chile pork shoulder, and 1 briased beef short rib, then I went Chirstmas with the sauce (1 red and 1 green). FRom here you can add a fired egg, more cheese, hand made quac. The whole enchilada is here... unless you want this as a taco then its the whole taco.  If you are in the PHX area drop in get some enchiladas or tacos and let me know what you think. Remember to check out the menu before you go your neck will thank you.

Love this place. I am pregnant and every time I walk in I am overjoyed by the smells. We've gotten soups and tacos, chips and guacamole each time and they are all delicious. I never get tired of the tortilla soup and the tacos are a great size. The prices are amazing for how great the food is. Saw a good deal of complaints on these reviews about the cleanliness and I think the management is doing things about it, saw an employee wiping everything down when I was there today. Someday when I'm really hungry, I'll try an enchilada. I can't wait! Yum

This tiny enchie shop is making a name for itself far and wide. Two other people had already told me about this place before my companion and I ate lunch here. It didn't disappoint.  The line moved quickly given the fact each order was individually made. The employees are adept, and the food is enticing and delicious even though its served in bowls that are reminiscent of dog dishes.  Clean, retro-industrial decor with a chalkboard menu which features specials and limited-time offers.  I had the salad, with chicken and toppings. Tacos, enchies and soup are other options.  Word to the starch fans: no beans or rice to be found here. If you want extra calories, you'll have to find them in the cookies or corn chips.  Outdoor seating also available. Soda or beer.

At first glance, the place is reminiscent of Chipotle, however the food actually has flavor. This has easily become one of my favorite Mexican joints in Phoenix. This is definitely for guys like myself who are always trying to grab something filling and fairly cheap like chipotle, but are starting to become sick of the same bland flavors of Chipotle. I usually get the rib meat and chicken all in their freshly made half flower and half corn enchilada. Also, I highly recommend their corn bread as a side even though it costs a little extra, you will thank me later. There are many sauces and condiments available, so do not be scared to have the staff run through each ingredient with you as they usually do anyway. Also add an egg to your enchilada if you're feeling wild!

Thought I would have dinner here, since I was in the area. I opted for enchiladas filled with braised short rib (so tender) & spinach n mushroom, Christmas style and topped with habanero lava, pickled onions and slaw.  It was very good.  The place is med size with outdoor seating.  The menu is simple: tacos, enchiladas and soup. The guys walk you through the process to build your meal, which is great if this is your first time, like me.  Quick and easy, will definitely be back.

I finally got to try this place and I was not disappointed. The enchiladas were phenomenal. Ordering was pretty easy and the guys behind the counter were friendly and willing to answer questions. The portions are big and I was able to take half of it home. Gadzooks is a great place for a quick, delicious meal.

Two enchilada: green chili pork and marinated chicken, red and green sauce, crema, cheese, pico and fried egg. Loved it! Two enchilada, beer and a coke for $14 and change, can't beat that. Will be back soon.
Great place for lunch or a lite dinner. The service is great and friendly staff. My only complaint was the giant menu written high up on the wall, it puts a strain on your neck.
Sunday brunch potatoes are insanely good. Potato enchiladas, red sauce, guacamole, slaw, pico = heaven

I love this place. So far I have been about 6 or 7 times. I always get the same thing, two 50/50 tortilla enchiladas with chicken, green sauce, both cheeses, pico, guac, and crema. The chicken is so flavorful, nice heat but not overwhelming. I also recently tried the mashed potatoes and they baked it in the same dish as the 'ladas. The potatoes are so good! I might try them as a filling some time if I can ever step away from that delicious chicken.

It's good.  It's like "...a Chipotle for enchiladas"  (which brings up the question, why doesn't Chipotle do enchiladas?)  It's just not a bargain.  I got two enchiladas, one bison, one green chili chicken.  With a drink, it was $9.    The bison was a whole lot of nothing.  Carolinas puts out a better machaca beef enchilada for, I think, $2.75.  The green chili chicken was delicious and had a nice zing to it.  And the "Lava" hot sauce was EVERYTHING IT SHOULD BE!  Flavorful, spicey, excellent.  What DID look REALLY delicious were the chopped salads.  Alright, "a" chopped salad, meaning the guy in front of me.  They piled everything for the salad in an enchilada bowl, dramatically dumped it out on a chopping board and then chopped it in front of you.  I saw this guy, the guy in front of me in line, on his way out the door, and I asked him, "was it as good as it looked?"    "Better", he said.  "Friggin' GREAT salad!  Also, not inexpensive.  And by the way, "half a spoon" of guacamole, for $1, sucks.  I know avocados are expensive, but it's not worth it.

Incredible variety, fast service, Highly Recommended!  Food: As others have said, this is a Chipotle-style place (think build-your-own) that serves mainly enchiladas and tacos. But if enchiladas and tacos aren't your thing, you can build your meal using a different base, such as tortilla soup, poblano chilis, or a salad base. Since I wanted to go low-carb, but with some spice, I started with the poblanos. This was a good choice, then the difficulty comes in deciding what to add to the base - there are soon many options! To stuff my two poblanos, I finally selected green chile pork, and roasted tomatillo chicken - and they were awesome!! I topped them with "Christmas" sauce (red and green), chihuahua cheese (like cheddar), and pico. They put your creation through the oven to bake it and seal in the flavors, then you add the toppings.  The taste was amazing! And there are so many combinations to try! Yummy on steroids!  Cost: My two-poblano meal, with iced tea, was $10.43 including tax, which was very reasonable.  Service:  The staff were fast, although not very helpful in guiding me to the perfect enchilada.   Atmosphere: Ok, functional, but no booths or privacy.  Overall: Amazing flavors, so many options, I will definitely be returning again and again!!
Excellent customer service with lots of smiles 8/25 @2:45pm. Thanks for the patience and recommendations

This is a great little place offering an interesting take on the enchilada. Ordering is pretty much Chipotle-style, where you pick out your ingredients and toppings. However, the quality of the food far surpasses Chipotle, Cafe Rio or other similar places.   There are several ways to customize your enchilada, meats, sauces, cheeses and vegetarian fillings. You can also order a Poblano pepper stuffed with anything you want and served up enchilada style - absolutely delicious. They even have the option of throwing a fried egg on top, which is a must if you're looking for an authentic Southwest enchilada.

Had no idea what to expect.  It's set up almost like a subway of enchiladas.   Except..  They put your enchilada together with your choice of several difference really good meat choices, cheese etc.  then they add your choice of toppings and cheese - and then cook in little pans.  The result is awesome!  Love love love it

Great concept, well executed! This unique, Chipotle-like counter approach lends itself well to their selection of wonderful foods. I had the soup - VERY hearty and comforting, great flavor and thickness. The enchiladas were also fantastic, the chioces, add-ons and sauces were spectacular!! I would highly recommend.

Gadzooks is a mix between authentic Mexican food and Chipotle. In a create-your-own style dish you literally make your own enchiladas. It's phenomenal. Gadzooks has really revolutionized how I eat enchiladas. And who knew potatoes paired so well with Mexican food?!  Come here right now. You won't regret it.
Really liked it.  Very fresh ingredients and a flavor profile you won't get from bigger chain stores.  I'll be back with reinforcements next time!

Gadzooks was awesome. The menu is a little tricky to read on the ceiling before ordering, so look at the menu online before you come to help! I had 3 enchiladas and tried the short rib and pork. Both were delicious. My wife got a salad which was really cool - they put everything together in a big bowl, and then pour it out and chop up your salad. We will come back for sure!
I like the location but the food leaves much to be desired. The food was bland and the service was mediocre. I would urge you to spare yourself the disappointment.

I drove past this place for months (literally) on the way to work. Was it the goofy name or the strange relationship between enchiladas or soup that caught me off guard? Finally, my curiosity got the best of me, and I'm glad that it did. First off, these suckers are filling and a pretty good value. I'm a big boy and 3 of these things loaded up and I'm ready for a nap. Quality is very good on the ingredients and I love being able to customize my enchilada. Of course I loaded those things up with short ribs ,eggs, cheese and got it toasted! I enjoyed it, but not quite as much as my fiancée who gave it a five star and she said it was a hit with the in-laws. Win.

Have been there several times and have never had a bad meal or bad service. The braised short ribs and pork is amazing accompanied with the their margarita so delicious. Have tried the enchiladas and tacos and prefer the tacos. My only complaint I have is its a little warm inside but they have an open fire oven. They do have a nice patio which is lovely in the cooler months.
I am generous with one star. Stopped in yesterday with high hopes.

I was just driving around looking for somewhere to eat and saw gadzooks. I remembered saving it to my bookmarks of places to try. Realistically I rarely ever get around to this list, so I had to take this opportunity to try it. First impressions upon walking in, it was loud (lots of people there) and I just assumed it was a cafeteria type line. I was right! Thankfully I was right. The menu is written up high. Take your time to go over it cause there are lots of choices.   The first guy was nice and could tell I was new to the establishment. He directed me on the process and what you can do for the enchiladas.   I love the 50/50 tortillas. They are a little thicker and are in between a tortilla and pita in density. I thought it was perfect. I heard you could mix the fillings too but I just stayed pretty standard. I got the braised short rib and green chili pork. The pork was moist and tender. Short rib was tender but a little dry. Their guacamole is okay, habanero salsa is good, the heat doesn't kick you right away. Wouldn't say it is unbearable either (especially for being habanero).   All in all go down the line and get what you think sounds and looks good. I wish I had a chance to try everything. Next time I plan on getting the works done to my enchiladas and a necessary fried egg ontop. I'm sad I didn't get one this time. Pretty sure I will be here later this week.

Tried this and loved it.  Lots of selections and the amazing choice to add an egg to any meal.  The green sauce is the perfect amount of spicy.  That jacked potato is perfect for any meal.  Add the green sauce and make a good meal great.

Gadzooks beats any chipotle or cafe rio! The rich enchilada sauce to the homemade tortillas. It was all so juicy, and yummy! It was a bit of drive for us but a 100% worth it. Great experience! I'm excited to go back for the next round of tacos and enchiladas. Super cute little joint, I loved the outside seating as well.

Lived up to the reviews & hype.  Absolutely amazing.  Owners of Jalapeños in Show Low told us this place is their fave when they are in the valley.  Unique presentation--pizza oven meets enchiladas.  Go for the $3 lada over two enchiladas.  Your taste buds will love Gadzooks!

Short rib tortilla soup is amazing, as is the cornbread.  I have never had a bad dish here.  Everything is on the slightly spicy side.  Good food and a comfortable casual environment (order-at-the-counter style).

Since my triumphant return to the valley of the sun, I had made a list of restaurants that were a must try and Gadzooks Enchiladas & Soup was at the top of that list! This place is similar to chipotle in concept but the quality of food doesn't even compare.   Being a newbie to the joint - I asked the guy behind the counter to make me what he usually eats. I think this is the best thing to do sometimes, It's fun to try things that other people recommend.   So of course I had to try the Enchiladas, I got one house corn and one made from scratch half n' half corn flour tortilla filled with green chilie prok shoulder and a sweet corn type filling in the other, I went christmas style and got the red and green sauce and asadero cheese, topped the sucker with a griddled fried egg and guac, salsa verde, with a little scratch made cream, crumbled cotija cheese, and pickled red onions!  Seriously delicious - and not pricey at all.... I can't wait for it to be soup weather so I can try their tortilla soup!   So, simply why should you come here?! - Fresh homemade ingredients - Huge portions, and great prices - Amazingly friendly and helpful staff - And there is booze  A must try!
Updating from when I first ate here right after they opened: They definitely worked out the kinks and my husband and I are frequent customers! Hint--get the guac on top! It is really good guac!

To quote my husband, "damn, this place is GOOD!"   And then he went back 3 times that week.  I was lucky enough to make the cut on one of his return trips, and all I can say is, "Damn! That place IS good!"

This place is awesome.  I've driven by many times not knowing what it was. Just think of it, chipotle style restaurant that serves enchiladas. Everything seems super fresh and high quality. It'll just be confusing your first time through the line, but it's worth it.   Go try it!

So I too have been patiently waiting for this place to open, as I drive by it daily on my way to and from work. I have also been CRAVING Mexican food, and enchiladas and soup were top on my list to indulge in! I understand that this was their 2nd day open, and I also agree that staff was extremely friendly and informational, the owners brother was even there helping out!  On to the food - I order for myself and another person, we got the short rib, pork verde and cheese enchilada. Mine was topped with guacamole, his with the tomatilla salsa. As for the enchiladas themselves, they smelled amazing, but the taste was far from it! There was little to no flavor from the meat. I was charged an additional $1 for the guacamole (that I wasn't told about), but the guacamole was delicious. My friend said the tomatilla salsa was the best part of his order. We also got some chicken tortilla soup... again, nothing special! :( It was nothing to write home about!  Overall, I am very disappointed with the food and had extremely high expectations and was let down!!!

So good! I went here today for the first time with my friend. I got two enchiladas (corn tortilla) one with short rib, the other with green chili pork. I got half red sauce, half green sauce, with jack cheese. I also got the sour cream type stuff on top. They were both absolutely delicious, and I can't wait to come back! The service wasn't the best I've ever had, but hey, I'm not going there to make friends, I'm going to eat delicious food!

Went here a couple nights ago with a friend of mine from the area. I'm from Atlanta, all I was told is "it's like chipotle but with enchiladas and soups instead". I was not disappointed with the short rib taco at all! Going back tonight with my girlfriend! Can't wait!

Yeah, not a huge fan. The price was okay. The enchiladas were okay (at best). The employees were okay. They seemed like bored robots. I wasn't quite sure how to order and they explained everything to me in a flat voice with a flat look on their face while looking over my shoulder. I wasn't asked if I wanted my order for here or to go and I only realized at checkout that they had made it in a container that was obviously not to go, so I had to have the checkout person put it in a to-go box which slowed down the line.   I sat at my desk at work and begrudgingly ate the food because I was hungry, but I made quite a few faces as I forced it to go down. It just tasted like a spicy-ish train wreck of flavors in my mouth. Won't be visiting again.

So excited to see new restaurants moving into district 4! Gadzooks is an amazing concept started by Aaron. I had their pork green chile and guajillo short rib "chirstmas style" enchiladas which means a combination of the red and green sauce. Its so cool to see them making the tortillas fresh in house and I absolutely loved their lava salsa which is so spicy but so good. Also the homemade guac is fresh and delicious. Cant wait to come back and try the bison.

This is one of my favorite spots in Phoenix.  The tortilla soup is legendary and all of the toppings are delicious and generously offered. I always order a side of the cornbread.. its amazing!  The shortrib enchiladas are super flavorful. I've also tried the nachos, and they are enough for an entire meal.  Every time I go, my eyes are bigger than my stomach! The line gets really long at lunch time, so its better to hit this place up at an off time.  This is the type of place that has something for everyone, and no one will leave disappointed!

Ah-mazing! Just left after eating there for the first time.  We tried you different kinds of enchiladas: pork and chicken, bought red and green sauces, and a plethora of toppings and ate a serving of the tortilla soup for good measure.   The winner in my books was the pork enchiladas with green sauce although the red sauce with its smoky flavors is on three list as well! The corn bread in the soup have it this amazing texture that isn't easily forgotten.    We will be back soon!
Yum. Full of flavor. I love their chips! Our kids eat here, but not their favorite place since its full of flavor.

Great food, but for goodness sake, GET SOME BLINDS! When the sun is setting it's like an ant sitting directly under a little boys magnifying glass. I see patrons trying to hold on to any bit of shadow available to shield their eyes. It's horrible!

Driving through Phoenix and it happened to be lunch time. I was at the red light sitting at the intersection where Gadzooks is located, did a quick Yelp lookup and decided to try it. I'm glad I did, because it was really good. I had the 2 enchilada plate. One short rib and the other chicken tomatillo. Both were good. They are super stuffed with meat, no skimping. After choosing my tortilla, all corn for me. (U can choose a half corn half flour tortilla), pick your filling - they have meat and vegetarian options. Cheese and sauce topping. Then its put in the fire oven briefly to warm and melt the cheese. Choose salsa and other condiment toppings and voila (or olé! In this case)  I was there during the lunch rush. People were constantly streaming in and the line moved quickly and food served quickly. Friendly staff. Great food. Nice easy parking on site.   If you have little ones, there are booster seats and high chairs but no changing tables in the restroom.   Glad I took a chance on this place and would definitely try again! Maybe soup on a cold day in Phoenix....

There's a reason this place was empty when we walked in. Don't let the adobe oven fool you, the corn tortillas are thick & flavorless, and the vegetarian options were just kind of pasty filling. I will say the salsas were descent but paying $9 for a single layer of nachos was insane and I'd rather eat Taco Bell. I know this sounds harsh, but as an AZ native, if you can't do Mexican Food properly and for a better price, there are at least a dozen taco trucks within walking distance that will.
I had veggie enchilada. It was delicious,  I'm always happy to see a good vegan iron on the menu. Great location,  trendy end of osborn. Outdoor seating will be great for our awesome Phoenix winter.

Really good food.  Fresh.  Yummy.  Get your enchiladas made exactly as you like them.  Check it out.  And like the guy in front of us in line said..make sure you order a side of cornbread.  It was good.

I had a 3 enchilada plate with jack cheese and Christmas sauce.  Short rib, pork, and mushroom spinach, with slaw and pickled onions on top.   The short rib was my favorite, followed by the pork. The spinach was a miss for me. No mushroom flavor. Only tiny bits among the spinach. But overall, the food was tasty.  I like the concept, but wish they had rice and beans as optional sides instead of just chips. I spent $14 on the enchiladas and drink but wasn't entirely filled up.

Honestly , it's overrated . Expected some spice and there wasn't any then the portion size is actually pretty small . It's a chipotle in a way expect I think i rather go to a taco truck then this .  They keep there food line pretty dirty and you couldn't tell what was what .

Overall my experience at Gadzooks was a dissappointment. I had been excited to try this place for months.   First, the customer experience is extremely lacking. The place was so quiet. There was no music, no tvs; just the awkward sound of echoing conversation from the other patrons. Not the worst thing ever though. I stared at the menu for at least five minutes before any aknowledgement. Then, the only words from behind the counter were "what are you getting?" For a new place, a little helpful guidance or possibly some explaination would be great. Especially when the have several types of tortillas, meats, cheeses and sauces. I don't really know what I want yet, because I don't understand whats going on yet. everone was grumpy, except the gal at the cash register. ;/  Presentation was not great either. The ceramic dishes wer nice, sturdy and cooled quickly. The to-go packaging was really neat as well. What wasn't neat, was the soup dish. It was a cup. Like, a paper cup that you put a fountain soda in. Uh... that seems pretty ratchet. no soup bowls, or paper soup cups? Also, the food along the toppings line was just sitting in an empty steam/cooling table in what looked like storage containers. Also, they only have 2, very small trash cans that were almost un-noticeable. Napkins, straws, silverware: all seemingly happhazardly thrown in a divider next to the fountain.Did they rush to open so quick, that they cut a few corners? It defintiely seems like it. They probably should have waited another month, so that customers would have a genuine "WOW' experience.  Next was the food. Simply put, I didn't like it. I can admit that the reason for this was no fault of the establishment, but my own personal tastes. It just wasn't my type. They definitely have some decent options but they were missing an obvious staple. BEEF! At least, I didn't see any, and as I stated earlier, the employees were less than helpful, so if there was a beef option with a zany nickname, I had no idea. The tortillas were either corn, or a corn/flour hybrid. I prefer flour, so they werent my favorite. The rating i am giving here is based 90% on my experience, not so much the food.  Final thought: After much built-up anticipation, I was underwhelmed when I got in, and left feeling hungry and frustrated. Hopefully, in a few months when I give it another shot, some noticeble customer service improvmnets will have been made.

I work at Chipotle. I came here after our Cultivate Festival in Scottsdale. I immediately felt familiar with the ordering process and was amazed at all the choices and even the fire oven! I got two enchiladas with some mashed potatoes. Ordering was simple as you walk down the line and tell them what you want inside, on the side, and on top. The food was every bit of delicious as I had hoped! They even had some homemade pumpkin-spice maple brown sugar cookies that were a great addition to the meal! I'll be back!

I really like the red and green sauce. The way they cook the enchilada like a pizza blends all the tastes together...It has a lot more overall taste than most quick food places...I think that they are on to something here...I would drive out of my way to eat there and the food matches the bill...
Food is good but portions are small, service slow, place is loud and in the eve the sun rages through the all glass west facing wall [no blinds] Behind the counter chaos, got multiple orders wring

The service was quick and helpful which is amazing because this place fills up fast! I mean fast!! By 11:20 there is a line to the door, which I understand because this place is amazing!   They have a wide selection of enchiladas, tacos and soups. You choose which meat or filling you would like. Next you choose something to smoother it with (yummy!) then you add any toppings you would like. I'm a sucker for enchiladas so of course that's what I got and it was amazing!!   Not only was the food great, but the atmosphere is chill and calm. They are playing radical face in the background for goodness sake :) love that group! I would definitely recommend this to anyone. Singles, teens, working adults, families and people with kids (they have high chairs, huge plus for moms with tots like me).

Ok this place is now officially one of my favorite spots in town. Authentic, fast, clean, delicious, affordable and relatively healthy. It's the type joint you're proud to take out of towners to show off Phoenix cuisine.

Plain and simple this is one of the best in Phoenix! The experience is fun and creating my own food fix is the best!   There are an endless amount of combinations you can get and the staff really knows their food!

My family loves this restaurant constantly bragging about the taste and uniqueness of the restaurant for the last three weeks. The night of the election we decided to take dinner home. You could imagine how excited I was until I found a rubber band in my chicken soup. So disappointed that this restaurant lacked quality control. See picture.

I don't really do Mexican food much. Boy, this place is #amazeballs . O. M. G. The in house hand made tortillas are addictive, the meat flavors are ridiculous. Wow!!!! #VeryImpressed glad am #NotLongerAVirgin

This is now going to be one of my favorite places to go for lunch or dinner. Unique enchiladas for sure! They are in a perfect spot on 7th Street facing Starbucks! The place is very easy to spot , and there are plenty of space for parking. I had the Spicy cornbread enchilada with different sauces and avocado. It was tasty, filling and delicious! Next time, I'm going to try it with an egg. I'm so glad they opened it in this location since I'm in this neighborhood all the time.

In a nutshell, Gadzooks is to Enchiladas, what Chipotle is to Burritos... except the food at Gadzooks is better.   The first time I came here it was a -- let's test out how stressed Jon can get before passing out event. It was super loud, lots of people and I've never been a fan of the whole cafeteria line, create your own type of ordering systems... so there was that.   Confused and anxiety ridden, we shouted our order at the mostly friendly folks on the other side of the sneeze guard. They could surely tell we were newbs and taking into account how busy it was, they handled it nicely.   Frustrated, we made it down to the check out spot where the magic happened. They have the Coolest twine tying thingy (I'm pretty sure that's the manufacture name) that ties up your to-go order. It's so bad ass. That put a smile on my face after, to this point, an overwhelming experience.   We left thinking we may not go back again because the stress just wasn't worth it. Then we got home with our bounty and pretty much after the first bite knew that was a premature ruling. The place does good enchilada.   I'm no expert, in fact, I never ate much Mexican style food until moving to Phoenix a year ago, but these were top 10 in my world. Especially taking into account that it's fast-casual. Not too fancy, just good food.   We've been back a couple of times since our first visit and the ordering process gets easier as you get use to it. The food has been great each time, and the twine tying thingy never ceases to delight.

Cool concept for enchilada lovers, build your own!  Can't get much better.  Would have been five stars if I didn't have to step back and read the menu board above me every few seconds.    Staff are extremely helpful and friendly!  Hope this places catches on and opens over on the east coast.

Came here with the bf on a tip from our airbnb host, this place did not disappoint. Chipotle style setup with enchiladas, such a genius idea! I tried the 50/50 tortillas, chile verde, braised short ribs, the xmas sauce, pickled onion, guacamole, fried egg... I'm sure I'm missing something. It was very delicious. Great flavors, great concept, great food. Coming from LA I definitely have high expectations for Mexican food and I'll be back for sure!

Have been here a couple times, can't complain. It's similar to a fresher, tastier Chipotle. I was slightly taken back at how the portions seemed small, however halfway through the second enchilada it's well worth the money! Deceptively filling and very tasty.

I work across the street from Gadzooks and waited for it to open for what seemed like forever. I just got a chance to try it today. The staff greeted me right away and could tell I had never been (i assume) they explained how everything worked to make my 1st time easy. The process was not hard at all unless you can't make up your mind what you like. They do have many choices which can seem overwhelming, but I was brave and decided quickly. I got the braised ribs and green chille pork enchiladas with the christmas sauce and tried a little of all of the cheeses. They topped everything and melted it together in the wood oven. I have to say that I very much enjoyed it and was a great experience. The food was very good and the place is very nice and clean. Will be going back for sure.

After finding somewhere with a four star rating and over 500 reviews I knew I had to try it out. I came here for a solo lunch while my boyfriend was hard at work for national guard drill.  Once you walk in its very similar to a chipotle with the ordering style. The downside is nothing is labeled so you have to keep pointing and asking, "what's that?" The bright side is all of the combinations and toppings. I went with two enchiladas, one chicken and one pork on corn tortillas. For toppings I went with the red and green sauce, jack cheese, slaw and jalapeño ranch. In the end I really liked the pork best. The chicken seemed a bit dry for me. As for the sauces I was tied between the red and green. I can recommend getting the slaw though, that was my favorite out of all the toppings. It gives the enchiladas that little bit of crunch they need.  Overall I'm really glad I tried this place out and would definitely come back to try some other dishes. I do advise getting there early since it tends to get pretty busy around 12:30 and there's somewhat limited seating.

This place is really really good. I was blown away with how much I liked this place. I wish I would have known about this place before. The quality and all the toppings make this place so unique. Pickled onions, slaw, 3 different salsas all fresh. Very clean restaurant and kitchen. I wish the built another location closer to my house. If you going with a baby I'll let you know that there are only 2 high chairs and last night I had to wait for one.

I love coming here, especially when it's cold out! The fire-cooked enchiladas warm me to my core and the flavors are phenomenal! All the ingredients are laid out for you to see, allowing you to customize your enchilada or taco. It can get pretty noisy, so be sure to speak up so the servers can hear you! The staff is fantastic and always project a pleasant attitude. The food may take some time to cook, but it's pretty quick considering it's all put together fresh to your specifications!

After finding out we didn't have time to go to one of the places originally on my list before heading to the airport, we found this place after a quick yelp search. And I'm glad we did. Like chipotle for enchiladas, but much, much better. I got the chicken enchiladas with all the trimmings and it was pretty darn good. I only wish we had one of these in NY, as the concept is awesome.
Spotted this place a few weeks back while driving down 7th St.....Last night we thought we would check it out...  The overall look of the place reminds me of Chipolte....

Food-ok.  Not terrible, not overwhelmingly great either. As a couple of other posters have said, your two enchiladas end up tasting the same after coming out of the oven ( this isn't a factor if you got each enchilada made the same way, but obviously if you have different fillings, meats, and toppings on each, it IS something to consider).  This was my first visit.  No short rib meat, they said it would be available in an hour or two.  This is a huge pet peeve of mine. How do you just "run out" of what is in fact your main ingredients that you advertise right up top on the menu? I get that stuff happens, but I've never understood this in the restaurant business.  Isn't it someone's  job to monitor the meat, coke, utensils, salt, lettuce, whatever the ingredient is, and order more when it gets low? Or at least SHOULDN'T it be, someone's job? Isn't the idea to be able to time it and plan so there is some overlap and you're never just sitting there "out" of something for a few days or even hours? I have no sympathy when this happens because it's easily avoidable with the right kind if oversight and forethought.  Their receipt roller/machine also wasn't working, no receipt.  Not a huge deal, but also not a great first impression thing either.  Also, no  inclusion of silverware with my to-go order, after I had already indicated it was "to go".  There may be plastic utensils there in the restaurant I could have grabbed, I don't know. It was my first time and no one mentioned that, and I didn't notice the lack of included utensils until I got home.  The food is what it usually comes down to, right? As I mentioned, the food here isn't bad, isn't great.  The price of $7.25 isn't bad for what you get (two enchiladas).  The pumpkin cookies  at the register are good, but the fact that you HAVE to buy two at a time ($1.80) and cannot buy one seems wrong. Two of these for $2 (with tax) seems like a bit of a stretch.  Atmosphere was fine, the place was also clean and the  service/attitude if the staff was  fine.  This place is ok.  The Yelp rating description for two stars "Meh.  I've experienced better" is right on target here.

I've only been during busy times. Food is great, however, the line is chaotic and they never have poblano peppers and say it will be 20 min to prepare.  I'd recommend going during non-peak lunch and dinner hours.

Very neat concept. I've been several times. The problem I have is the spice. I love spicy and can tolerate a lot but for some reason this place gives me tons of heartburn so I don't go as often as I'd like. I like to describe this place as like a Chipotle but for enchiladas. I've never seen soup and I had a hard time finding it on the menu. I'll try looking for it next time I go. Also, plan on paying around $12-15. The price is a little steep for a couple of enchiladas. All of my petty critiques aside, give it a try if you're in a hurry. It's not bad. Seating is limited though so if it's already 100+ out you better eat fast.

My classmate and I decided to come here, just to try.. So we walked in, ordered the chicken and short rib enchilada with Christmas sauce (red & green). I also ordered sweet & spicy corn on the side because it looked good. The people behind the counter were nice. It was like a chipotle style, you pick what you want on your enchilada. So I picked the home made sour cream, pico de gallo and cotija cheese and then they put it inside the brick oven. The enchiladas were okay, I expected a wet juicy enchiladas.. But it was dry. The meat also needs flavoring and it was also dry. Oh and the sweet & spicy corn was really spicy.

During our road trip, I was craving enchiladas the entire time. Maybe it was the Arizona heat or the bright red-orange rock on the roads, but I was destined to get some enchiladas in Phoenix.  Lucky for us, after a day in the museum, we made a stop at Gadzooks after seeing its great reviews! We were hesitant, since a "make your own" enchilada sounded a bit too Chipotle for us. However, it turned out amazingly delicious and we agreed 100% we would come back if ever back in Phoenix. The only thing similar to Chipotle is the style of how you order. The menu is large at the entrance. You basically choose your style--enchilada or taco. I really wanted my cheesy enchiladas, so I went with that. Their proteins are THE BEST. SO vege-friendly! I was curious about the jackfruit, but settled for one spinach and mushroom and the other with cornbread. Holy crap, their cornbread is out of this world. The spinach I could do without, so maybe next time I'll try the jackfruit.   They also have the option to add an egg, which we both did (cuz BAKED EGGS ARE HEAVENLY). I love that they have as many toppings as you want. We even mixed both of the sauces--try them both because they are delicious. The toppings are all so yummy and I honestly could not WAIT to dig into my enchiladas. They shove your creations into like a wood-fire oven similar to how pizza is made (if made right!) and if your order took a while like ours, they bring it out to you. The service by all of the workers here is fast and friendly! I think we had some younger service folks working that day, and they were so awesome. Plenty of seating outside as well as inside. Parking was not a problem with a private plaza. I loved Gadzook's!

Absolutely amazing. Think Chipotle for enchiladas. Nice patio, plenty of room inside. The food is really amazing. The prices are great. If you're not in the area it's actually worth the trip.   I ordered 2 chicken enchiladas. I'll be back to try the tacos!

Good food worst service. Everytime we have been here servers are just rude.   Enchiladas are really good, my beau tried naked enchiladas with buffalo and chicken for low carb lovers. I  tried flour tortilla chicken with spinach half and half. Food is good but servers just spoil whole mood.

I ate there yesterday and I think they have fixed the problems other users had below.  The menu is simple and they explained it to me as soon as I got there.  It's basically tacos, enchilades and soup. I didn't try the soup.  You have a choice of made to order corn or flour tortillas. Then they fill it with choice of fillings. I highly recommend the shortrib but the green chile chicken was very good too. Then you choose toppings like picked onions, pico de gallo, enchilada sauce, crema & cheeses.  Everything is really fresh and delicious. I also tried the guac which was fantastic.  The entrees are less than $7, so you can actually eat lunch for under $10, which is great.  The concept seems similar to, but a step above, Chipotle.  In fact, I liked it so much that I was craving it and actually went back again today.  The employees both days were very helpful and asked if I'd had a good experience.  Frankly, it was an excellent lunch and I have no complaints. I will go there often. If you had a bad experience, I think it is worth a second chance!

Both the food and customer service here is fantastic! We came in for the first time 30 minutes before closing and they described every topping for us without seeming the slightest bit annoyed, even though they had began their closing tasks (which is more than I can say for most other places). I got the chicken enchiladas and they were probably the best I've ever tasted! I will definitely be visiting this place again some time soon

Hubby drives all over the Valley everyday and he kept seeing how busy Gadzooks was so on his day off we went.  Mmmmmm, glad we did.  He had ribs and spinach mushroom enchiladas and I had green chili pork.  I have been back with my sister and when our cousin comes down at the end of this month we are taking her there!  Good food, spicy but not heartburn spicy.  Lots of sauce and topping choices too.

The food is good and the service was good too. I ordered the short ribs and green chile pork enchiladas. They both were good but I like the green chile pork the best. They place reminds of chipotle but with enchiladas. For real authentic Mexican food this might not be the place but it is still great option over Taco Bell.

Been here once before but forgot to write a review and it was so good I had to come back just so I could write a review! :) so I got two enchiladas one short rib and the other green chili pork! Both are extremely phenomenal!! They have three different sauces to choose from either Verde (green mild) medium and hot, I have only tried the verde so far but I'm sure they are all delicious

Pretty cool place! Great customer service, friendly staff, neat idea of the way its set up, build your own enchiladas! The only thing I would want to change a little is to add rice and beans to the enchiladas (like on the side) I love enchiladas but I need a little more variety. Eating a huge bowl of just enchiladas gets a little bland. Other than that, definitely recommend it for people to try!

First time here.  Kind of Chipotle-like in how you make your selections and assemble your enchliada bowl.  Lots of selections (chicken, short rib, bison IIRC)...choices of toppings, cheeses, sauces.   Made for a tasty lunch
Great flavor profiles, with local places like this it is clear to see Chipotle has become a tired restaurant concept.

This place was YUM.  I threw this place immediately on my list when I drove by a few months ago. My kids had to use the potty and we just got back from LA. Maybe I was hungry, but let's be real. Mexican food is always delicious. And then you go ahead and tell me I can have enchiladas?   Just. Yes.  It's kind of like Chipotle in that you select your item (soup, salad, enchiladas, tacos) and then you go through each station to tell them what you want. But then there's the magic part.  They take your perfect creation and put it in a quick pizza oven rotation that makes the cheese all perfect bubbly brown. THEN, you top it with slaw, salsas, and pickled onions if you want (which you do, promise).  I went with the cornbread filling (which is broken up and mixed cornbread with green chilis and other happiness mixed together. On my second one, I chose spicy potatoes as my filler (OMG) and topped it with "Christmas" red and green.   This place is a dream for me. I love me some enchiladas and I got to have them, quick and fast and customized. I topped with their crema (fancy for sour cream) and stuffed my face.  The chips are fresh made and the guac is too-- but if you're not into the chunky with jalapenos and onions, I'd steer clear-- my daughter wasn't a fan, but that just meant COME TO MAMA.

Gadzooks! YAY! Initially I was a bit leery of the "redefining the enchilada" slogan. I thought, "I do not want to "redefine the enchilada, I love enchiladas just the way they are." However, I was extremely surprised & thrilled by Gadzooks. The tortillas are made fresh & onsite, as are all the menus items. Although, the menu is posted high on the wall & the restaurant is run buffet style, do not be discouraged. Gadzooks makes the best enchiladas & tacos! Each order is personalized to the specific likes of the customer. There are a multitude of options for the vegetarian set & all of them are delicious!  I've yet to try their soups, but I hear they are fantastic. The staff is kind, and helpful and they know their products well. Although, busy during the lunch time rush, Gadzooks is well worth the wait. I know the owner is the first one there in the morning & the last to leave. Thus, showing great pride in a very unique concept. Go! Go! GO!

This place is awesome. Can't wait to go back. Only thing was that a lot of the menu was spicy but I managed to come away with a dish that was flavorful and not spicy. Pork enchiladas. Ate it so fast forgot to take a pic

What is Gadzooks trying to do? Make a better restaurant than Chipoltle? Well they succeeded! And that is no easy task.  I love Gadzooks! The fresh and different ingredients. The corn or flour tortillas uniquely Gadzooks. Tacos just as good as the enchiladas. And freshly melted cheese in the oven. I feel sorry for employees having to constantly stick their arms in a super hot oven but my stomach thanks you! I could go on and on about the incredible tacos and enchiladas, but I just have two words...tortilla soup! I get it every time and it's super bueno! Took my wife to Gadzooks for the first time on her day off and impressed the heck out of her! Happy wife equals a happy husband!  The Decor is spiffy too. Really nice illustration on the wall of a giant enchilada that actually helps explain their ingredients. It's these little well thought out details that makes The Gadzooks name synonymous with quality!
Good food fun vibe.  Bison and short rib enchiladas, very good.  Lava sauce actually hot!! Bueno Buebo.   Small parking lot but a must try.

Tell me why they dont have a location in southern California? !?!  This is the chipotle of enchiladas! !! How much better can it get?   I got 2 enchiladas with green sauce. Ine was potato  (my fave) and the 2nd was brisket. They were fire grilled in a neat ceramic looking plate bowl. Absolutely delicious!   I will for sure come back!

Hello, would you like to know the secret of life? If you worship at the temple of the almighty carb (which I am wont to do and really need to stop making a habit of), here you go:  Mashed potatoes. Inside an enchilada.  I could basically stop there, because what the hell else do you need to know?! But some more deets:  I ordered 2 enchiladas in their 100% corn tortillas (pressed in front of our own eyeballs!), one filled with the mushroom/spinach mixture, one with the godly mashed potato filling.  I picked "Christmas style" (both red and green sauces) because WHY NOT! Although I am an avid verde lover, so I think I'll go full on green sauce next time.  Asadero cheese.  Pico. Picked red onion.  HEAVEN.  We split some chips/salsa/gaucamole on the side, because you might as well go all out. The food was stupid, in the best way possible. I like a little golden to my cheese (all pizzas/cheese-topped foods in my house get a 30 broiler blast at the last cooking minute), and was pleasantly surprised when my little 'lada bowl came out of their oven just like that. Perfect! The mixture of toppings was superb.  The only recommendation I can give is to perhaps put a label of what's what on the front see-through guard as people order. There are a lot of fillings/toppings/salsas/extras and it was a little awkward to have to step back and look immediately above my head and strain to see all the details of what I could order. If anything, it could make the employees' lives easier.  Last word: Pumpkin cookies. Get them. See how life changes for the better.

Im rating this on a vegetarian stand point so for you meat eaters the experience will probably be different. That being said, i also thought that the overall quality of the food is not so great. For vegetarians there is only one filling option, sauteed spinach and mushroom and it is kind of like baby food in texture. The red sauce has chicken broth init. I got 2 corn enchiladas. The enchiladas themselves were bland. Ifi hadnt added extra quacomole, coleslaw, cheese, crema, and salsa to it, it would have been very boring. Pretty much youre paying for the toppings. If youre vegan you are even more limited. You could only have salsa and guacomole and onions. The chips and salsa though were really good. I could have made a whole meal out of the chips. The service was great. The person serving me was very kind about taking me through it step by step and making sure i got vegetarian items. So i wont be going back. No point in paying for guacomole and salsa and cheese and chips and stuf when I could make that all myself or get it all from safeway or something in bulk for the same price.

First time and it was delicious! Tried the tomatillo chicken with cornbread enchilada, flame broiled, then covered in salsa. It was a must try. Tasted the bison and that too was moist and tasty! I will be coming back to try other custom experiences!

We stopped here on out way to the airport and it was great. Imagine Chipotle but 100x better. It was a Saturday, so it is hard for me to comment on the parking or the seating, though it was full and we sat outside in the misters. I had a cornbread enchilada with green salsa and cheese and it was perfect. Too bad no Gadzooks in MA.

This place is fantastic!  Food is always as fresh as can be, served in piping hot dishes and so filling. Great beer selection in bottles and the chips and gauc are do die for. I will be coming here for a long time ...Did I hear franchise???

I have lived in the valley for 23 years and this is one of my absolutely favorite top 3 restaurants in the city. It's fast casual, chipotle style enchiladas but every ingredient is made from scratch right in front of you.   The food has incredible depth of flavor. Every component has been flawlessly executed every time I have been here.   The ambience is casual and often very crowded. The owner is almost always running around and is super friendly.

This place is delicious. Lots of variety and sitting. I ordered 2 Enchiladas 1green chili pork and 1 potato. They covered it with Jack cheese and then placed it in a pizza oven so it would get hot and bubbly. Then I dressed it with lettuce, pico, sour cream, and guac. Got a side of chips too. The chips are like the good ones you would get freshly made from a Mexican supermarket almost. Everything was yummy. Well priced around $8-$10 a person. Only down fall was the line out the door.

Ate at Gadzooks twice.  The first time left me in a gaseous aftermath which we shall never speak of.   Note to self:  no.  pickled.  onions.  The second time, I got the poblano pepper stuffed with spinach and mushrooms.  By itself the spinach/mushroom is rather bland so I had the peppers topped with pico de gallo and guac.  These were the only two toppings from my first visit that I liked.  I also got a side of the spicy cornbread.  (Tasty!)  They were out of cookies and chips that evening.   Note to restaurant:  Make.
