A few of our people didn't specify what type of salsa they wanted, so the owner brought all three types! I must say their execution of our order was outstanding along with the food. We've gone out to Gadzooks before and service was excellent then, and this just shows excellence is in everything they do!

I'd had Gadzooks on my list to try for awhile and I finally had the chance to pop in yesterday for lunch.  The ordering process was easy, with the help of the friendly employees.  It was a good thing it was not too busy while I was ordering, since I had a lot of questions!  Of course, people piled in at just the right time.    There are so many different, delicious options to add to your enchiladas, tacos or soup.  We ordered two soups and two enchiladas to share, but we didn't have much room for the enchiladas after we finished our soups!    The soup, incidentally, was not only filling, but delicious!  I had a "cheat" day and ate some chicken in my soup.  It was phenomenal and really worth it.  The soup seemed heavily salted, but the flavor was intense with the habanero salsa and cornbread that was added.  It was one of the best soups I have had at a restaurant (nothing can usually beat homemade).    The enchiladas that we ordered were bison (a nice treat) and braised short ribs.  I had a small bite and found them quite delicious with the fresh crema on top.  We had added the spiciest green salsa to the enchiladas prior to them being warmed and then added the habanero and the mild green to them when they came out.  That crema really pulled the flavors down a notch and made them even more decadent.  I am not a big meat eater, but I have always preferred bison when available.  In this case, I think I liked both the beef and the bison equally; they were seasoned well.  We even ordered some pumpkin cookies for dessert.  They were a little cakier than I expected, but I was indulging so... why not?  One of the kind employees came to check up on us once we were finishing our meal.  I know some other reviews had issues with the service, but I had none.  I will be back in the next couple weeks to try something else.  I will probably try the potato at that time, but I might be convinced to cheat again for this meal.  It was only $17 something for all the food you see in the pics I posted.  If you're spending that kind of money eating from a fast food chain, "you're doing it wrong."  P.S. The bathrooms were some of the cleanest I have encountered in downtown Phoenix.  That has to be mentioned!

Enchiladas the "Chipotle" way.  Choose flour or corn tortillas and then decide what you want.  Tell them if you want tacos or enchiladas and the only difference is the enchiladas they roll up and put enchilada sauce over them.  Nice different concept on tacos and enchiladas, good for a quick meal and something different.

I can't give five stars purely because I haven't physically been there, I've only had take out through work. So I can't say how the service is but the food is amazing!! It was very Chipotle style but with enchiladas. I love that you can do call ahead orders very practical for being in downtown phoenix next to a ton of business. I recommend checking it out, ASAP I loved it!!

I'm not sure how I could be such a fan of this place and not have written a review!  Gadzooks!  Eee gadz!  And gee whillikers!    Gadzooks is located in the heart of midtown Phoenix.  It is on a very busy corner at 7th Street and Osborn.  But, fortunately, there are no valets for parking!  You may self park your own car and I love that.  I'm the odd ball yelper.  I don't go here for the Enchiladas.  I go here for the soup part.... Yeah, uhm....did you notice the word "Soup" in the name of the restaurant?  Hehe...  I love their tortilla soup so much that I could easily eat it a couple times a week.  You can chose the meat/toppings to add to your soup or chose the grilled veggies.  These options are the same for the tacos and enchiladas.  I also add a touch of Pico de Gallo and a bit of the Hot salsa.  Perfection in a bowl for me.  They also serve a corn chowder that I have yet to try.  Actually, I found my favorite item and I just basically stick with it.  Jajajajajaja!  Return factor:100%.... I'm headed there now.
First visit, and it delivered everything everybody said it would!! Worth the trip from Gilbert.

This place was recommended to me by a friend for date night with my fiance. I was kind of skeptical because of some of the reviews, however our time here was very enjoyable! I heard that the staff could be unfriendly, yet they were extremely nice & helpful. There were so many options & they took their time to explain how it worked & what was available. I noticed that was consistent throughout the night, because they also helped a vegan customer customize her meal; which is very nice of them to do! And they did it willingly and without attitude. The food was really good. They offer a variety of meats, salsas and toppings. I have 2 enchiladas with red & green sauce & chicken inside. Very good! Salsa was fresh & their guacamole was yummy! My fiance had 3 enchiladas, 2 filled with green chile pork and one with bison, extremely good! We both enjoyed our time here. My fiance tried their grapefruit margarita & he said it didn't disappoint! The view on the outside patio was nice & it was nice to sit out on a beautiful evening in arizona! We will be back, because I need to try the spinach and mushroom tacos with jalapeno ranch dressing & cabbage!!!
